help.title: GARANT Platform F1 EXPERT. User Guide

topic.p: Dear users!

We present to you a new version of GARANT System - Platform F1 EXPERT having accumulated a large number of important new features and improvements. The new version significantly improves the search and analysis of legal information, simplifies and speeds up your work with the system.

td.div: General view of the program window

topic.p:
Platform F1 EXPERT is a major step forward at the market of legal systems since 2004 - the date of issue of the first version of Platform F1. The new product enhances the ideas and continues the ways of development inherent in the Turbo version.
GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT developed with participation of scientists of the M.V.Lomonosov Moscow State University utilises the most up-to-date technologies and implements a range of new unique features. This permits to take account of many desires of our users and make the work with legal information simple and convenient as much as possible.
This page provides a list of new features of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT. A more detailed description may be found if you follow appropriate links:

ul.li: Improved Basic Search.
Sending documents over e-mail.
Vivid depiction of various types of links.
Sending lists over e-mai.
Drag-and-drop saving of list documents in My Documents.
Permanent use of filters.
Failure-to-get-a-reply warning because of the absence of connection.
New look of the system entry dialogue box.
Automatic determination of the optimal size of buttons.
User notification of invalid entry in the context filter and search-by-details fields.
Notification of users working with single-user network options.

topic.p: This page lists the main new features of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT of the November issue of 2007.

ul.li: Basic search.

New interface.
New Main Menu.
Updated toolbars.
Task bar.
Transfer of search-by-details values into the Online Legal Advice Service query card.
Checking connection to the Online Legal Advice Service.
Graphic design of the legal advice printout.
Menu of operations with document fragment.
New features of work with document structure.
Disabling GARANT System comments and user comments in the current document only.
Links for quick transfer between list documents.
AutoFit feature for printing large tables.
Screentips for Internet links in the document text.
Graphic pictograms to mark the details.
Finding exact matches in context search.
Optimisation of document names in the list.
Improved Save-List-to-File dialogue box.
Improved Save-to-My-Documents dialogue box.
Denying user self-registration.
Context filter and packet operations for user list.
More vivid icons to notify of important events (change of flagged documents and reception of new replies of the Online Legal Advice Service.).
Object sorting in My Documents folder.
Vivid design of active and non-active tabs.
Vivid indication of the system busy status.
Information type renamed.

topic.h3: What Is the Online Legal Support?
topic.p: The online legal support is a new feature for users of the legal reference system GARANT. In the framework of the online legal support, you can get access to two services any moment of your work with GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT:

ul.li: The Hot Line of user legal information support. The given service is included in the standard packet of services available to all registered users of GARANT System. In the framework of the Hot Line service, you can get operative aid while working with the system, as well as make a request to find rare legal acts.
Legal Advice. This service permits you to apply directly from the GARANT System for legal advice to the experts of the Garant Company legal advice service.

topic.p: The Legal Advice service requires a separate connection.
The text of the received advice may include the list containing references to documents used to prepare the expert reply. All replies undergo an additional centralised check.
You can assess the received reply and send your remarks.
* - More detailed description of the terms of getting the written legal advice may be found in the Rules of Work with the Online Legal Support Service.

annotation.p: The introduction have gathered various information pertaining to GARANT System: the goals of the system, technical requirements, information on the developer and the procedure to get technical support.

topic.p: The context guide to GARANT System consists of several sections of various destination. This page explains which of the guide sections should be addressed to get quickly the answer to any question.

topic.h3: Definition of the Legal Reference System
topic.p: The legal reference system is a computer application containing a full, systematic and operatively updated information on the legislation, as well as the software for searching, analysis and processing of this information.

The main components of the legal reference system include: the databank, containing document texts and auxiliary information, as well as the program shell, providing service resources for work with the databank.

The content of the databank of GARANT System is determined personally depending on the information requirements of each user. A universal program shell is used, with all users interacting with the system through the common, uniform for all interface.
topic.h3: Service Functions of the Legal Reference System
topic.p: Let us list the benefits that we get through electronic presentation of information with a preliminary legal processing of connected documents. Let us emphasise that all these functions are provided thanks to the thorough preliminary processing of incoming documents carried out by the company's lawyers.

ul.li: Compact storage of information. The legal reference system permits to store compactly necessary document and analytical materials. Special processing of information permits to pack in a comparatively small database more than one million documents comprising the large sets of GARANT System. The number of documents in the current database may be found in the Set Information window.

Finding a particular document. The legal reference system is an instrument of quick search of necessary documents among millions comprising the legislation. If you know document details, you can find it using the Search-by-Details tool.

Document search by the areas of legislation. All legal information included in the GARANT System is classified according to the uniform legal classifier. The Legal Navigator permits a consecutive transfer over the classifier tree structure, while refining step by step the circle of issues under consideration. As a result, a list of documents is produced to regulate the subject selected by the user for navigation.

Document search by keywords. GARANT System permits to find documents using the description of the practical problem. Even without knowing the document details, you can easily get a selection of legislative acts pertaining to the particular issue. It is enough to select one or several situations in the Search-by-Keywords window.

Getting additional document information. Legal reference system user gets its interconnections, history of changes, Garant Company lawyer comments and other analytical information on the document. Description of all features is available in the Documents section.
Operative updates of the whole document mass. Telecommunication updates available through the Internet permit to get new documents on the day of their issue.

Tracking document changes taking account of their interconnections. The amendments introduced by the normative legal acts of the New Documents section are automatically registered in the texts of the changed documents. The previous wordings of the changed documents are still available in the Wordings list.

Guarantee of authenticity. Many bodies of power and departments hand over information directly to developers. All document texts undergo multiple checks to verify the compliance with the official sources. The system permits to check personally its reliability using the function of Graphic Image of Official Publication.

Auxiliary tools integrated in the system provide for a comfortable work with the found documents. The folders are envisaged for storage of your information. The export commands permit to save the document on the hard disk, copy it to MS Word or print it out.
List filters will speed up your work with large volumes of information.

topic.p: The multitude of GARANT System features is described on the pages of the Guide section.
The present requirements are the minimum ones recommended by developers for work with GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT.

The requirements to the operating system and computer power depend on the particulars of its use. If the computer is used to launch the shell only, they are different from the case when the computer fulfils the functions of a server in a network version. For a better understanding of the terms use on this page, it is recommended to get acquainted with the System Architecture.

sel.font: CD ROM or DVD ROM drive

tr.td: CD-ROM or DVD ROM reading device is necessary to install and update the system.
For the Help file of Platform F1 to work correctly, it is necessary that Internet Explorer version 4.0 of higher be installed on the computer.

topic.p: The shell is launched on the computers of users of the local version and the working disk, as well as the clients of the network (client server or file server) versions.

tr.td: Windows 98 Second Edition, Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows 2003, Windows Vista

The program shell needs about 205 MB. The space occupied by the databank ( GARANT System databank stores document texts and auxiliary information necessary, in particular, for a quick and efficient search. In the case of the network version, the databank is installed on the server computer, and in the case of the local version, together with the shell. ) may be up to 60 GB. In the case of update, double the amount may be required.

Windows regional settings must be localised for Russia. (All settings in the Language and Standards section must be either Russia or Russian). Besides, the Russian language must be included in the list of languages supported for the entry from the keyboard.

topic.p: The application server of the network client server option is usually installed on the specially allocated powerful computer providing access over the network for other user computers (work stations).

The requirements to the server computer are described proceeding from ten active users working simultaneously with the databank. In the case of a greater number of users or installation of a larger set, computer power should be increased.

tr.td: TCP/IP protocol. By default, Platform F1 EXPERT uses Port 5051 for client requests. This port may be changed at installation. The server sends replies to the work stations to the port in the range from 3600 to 3609.

Executable files occupy about 205 MB. The space occupied by the databank ( GARANT System databank stores document texts and auxiliary information necessary for a quick and efficient search. In the case of the network version, the databank is installed on the server computer, and in the case of the local version, together with the shell. ) may be up to 60 GB. In the case of the data update, double the amount of the disk space may be required.

Any Windows-based platform using NT technology with all officially issued updates, service packs, patches etc. See example ( Windows 2000 Professional, Windows 2000 (Advanced) Server, Windows XP Home Edition, Windows XP Corporate Edition, Windows 2003 Server, Windows Vista and other )

For the folder where the server part of the shell is installed, one needs the full rights of the SYSTEM or EVERYONE user group.
The application server must be launched by the user enjoying the ADMINISTRATOR rights.

topic.p: Requirements to the file server power are not specified. This is because the shell is not usually launched on such server. If the client part must and may (32-bits Windows OS is installed on the file server) be launched from the file server, one should be guided by the requirements for the program shell.

The shell and the databank may be installed on the file server only from the Windows (Windows 98 Second Edition, Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows 2003, Windows Vista) computer where the resource allocated for GARANT System Platform F1 is available with the write rights.

tr.td: Executable files occupy about 205 MB. The space occupied by the databank ( GARANT System databank stores document texts and auxiliary information necessary, in particular, for a quick and efficient search. In the case of the network version, the databank is installed on the server computer, and in the case of the local version, together with the shell. ) may be up to 60 GB. In the case of the data update, double the amount of the disk space is necessary.
Windows 98 Second Edition, Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows 2003, Windows Vista, Novell Netware, Linux, Solaris, FreeBsd and other

topic.p: You can find the list of services for the registered users of GARANT System using the program itself.
In the Menu item, choose Reference Information\ Hot Information and follow the link User Services. The opened page will show the following information:

ul.li: Actualisation and expansion of the databank
Learning to work with GARANT System
Hot Line of information and technical support
Book of comments and suggestions

annotation.p: This section describes GARANT System explaining the main interface elements (windows and panels) comprising the program. Numerous illustrations will help you master the program interface and facilitate the reading of the reference documentation.

td.div: Main elements and their names.

topic.p: The composition of the GARANT System Principal Window is typical for modern Windows applications. The window contains the Main Menu, the Toolbar and the Navigation Panel surrounding the Main Window used to load the documents, lists, search cards and other objects. Information on the objects under consideration is displayed in the Additional Window.

td.div: System Principal Window and its components.

topic.p: You can open several principal windows simultaneously:

td.div: Suitable GARANT System features include opportunities of opening several principal windows, each of them permitting to work independently as if with a separate system copy.

topic.p: Opened windows may be positioned on the screen using Cascade or Tile Vertical commands.

The Navigation Panel is placed by default in the left part of the system Main Window and contains a dynamic ( the number and composition of tabs may change depending on the context. The necessary tabs are opened automatically, the unnecessary ones are closed) )
set of tabs to access various system functions.
The panel composition is described in the Guide on the page Navigation Panel.
The composition, size, location and behaviour of the Navigation Panel may be controlled. This issue is described on the page Panel Control.

td.div: Navigation Panel. Switching between pages is done using the tabs.

topic.p: Each system window, including the principal one, has one or several adjustable toolbars. The type and composition of toolbars is determined by the selected configuration.

Thus, for the Main Configuration, the toolbars have buttons to invoke the main functions that are requested most often, all buttons being of enlarged size, the majority supplied with screentips. This permits to master the system quicker and simplifies the work with it.
For succession purposes, the toolbars of the Expanded Configuration duplicate the toolbars of the previous version of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT.

The composition of toolbars is described in detail in section Guide divisions describing the parent windows of these toolbars. To independently set the panel appearance and composition , use the Settings... command from the toolbar context menu (invoked with the right mouse button).

td.div: Toolbars

topic.p: You can move the toolbars as convenient for you or switch them over to the floating mode by dragging with the mouse:

td.div: Toolbars in the floating mode. To return the panel in the initial position, drag it with your mouse to the upper part of the window where it belongs.

topic.p: The Main Window is the working area where the document lists, their texts, search cards and other objects are loaded.

td.div: Document list loaded in the system Main Window. Such list is called the current one.

topic.p: Note the row of tabs in the lower part of the screen in the illustration. The tabs are used to view important information on the current document (or list).
This information is displayed in the Additional Window appearing in the lower part of the screen. The size of the Main Window is reduced.

td.div: Additional Window having loaded the legal reference to the current document.

topic.p:
The set of available tabs depends on the type of the current object. The sets are different for document and list.
For example, in the case of document, you may invoke a reference, lists of Correspondents/Respondents, the text of the legal warning (if available).
While being in the list, you can invoke information on the method of its generation or show the text of the document highlighted in the list.
The Additional Window has its own toolbar. You can work with texts and lists shown in the Additional Window the same way as with texts and lists in the system Main Window.

All search tools of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT are shown in the Main Window. The below example shows information on the composition of the query card of Search by Details. Other types of search may be found in section Search.

Search by Details is the system's most comprehensive search tool: the query card consists of the entry fields corresponding to all document details supported by the system. You will create search requests by filling in the fields of the query card with details known to you.
Since the total number of details is great enough, the card is divided into sections, each containing several details.

td.div: Query card. Unused sections may be wrapped as convenient. You cannot wrap the section by chance if at least one field is filled in: the wrap button of such section is blocked, and the filled field is always in front of you.

topic.p: All document details may be entered directly in the query card. For the vocabulary details presented in the form of a list (linear or hierarchy), there is an opportunity to choose the values from the special window. For example, if you want to open the list of the bodies of state power, you should follow the link Body/Source on the left of the entry field. The system will open a separate window where you can find and checkmark the necessary issuing bodies.

td.div: Section selection window.

topic.p: A detailed description of the work with the query card may be found on the guide pages Query Card and Search Details.

annotation.p: The given section describes in detail typical tasks solved using GARANT legal reference system. It lists the main features of the system and describes the ways to solve practical tasks.

We recommend to read this section to users who are not yet familiar enough with GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT. You may read the whole of it as a brief manual on the system. Later on, you may address it for specific purposes to get information to solve the particular tasks arising in the course of work.

topic.p: The section describes how to begin your work with GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT: launch the program and enter login, as well as register at the first system entry.
Particulars of switching over from version 5.x to Platform F1 EXPERT are described.
Possible problem situations are listed.
To start GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT for the first time on the machine where the program shell is installed, use the shortcut created by the installation wizard.
Press the Start button on the task bar and enter the menu item Programs/GARANT. Launch the system using GARANT shortcut.

In certain situations, the system may request registration information - login with a password (see System Entry). However, in most cases, the authorisation proceeds automatically without user involvement.
System loading continues if you log in successfully. Some time is required to prepare information for work. The screen will show a graphic design indicating the process of loading.

If you are working with a network client server single-user option and try to log in to a system "occupied" by another specialist, the system will issue a message indicating the name of the working user. This permits to determine who is working with GARANT System at the moment and find out if he may let you work for a while.

In the case of quick configurations (quick computer and the local network capacity for network versions ), the system will be ready completely when the indicator is full, however, slower computers will require some more time.

If GARANT System is launched on your computer for the first time, it suggests that you register or will do it independently. A new system User Profile will be created, which is necessary for storing your personal information. Besides, you will be offered to create a shortcut on the desktop to make further program launches more convenient.

ul.li: The network version (permitting to work simultaneously from several computers connected to the system server): you will be offered to choose a login with a password for subsequent system entry. See Registration. A new profile will be created with the specified login.

The local version (permitting to work on a single computer where it is installed): the system will create a new profile automatically, i.e. without your involvement. You can start your work immediately. The login/password combination for the new profile is ADMINISTRATOR/ADMINISTRATOR.

topic.p:
If GARANT 5.x version was used earlier on the given computer, the system behaviour at the first launch may be different. In some cases (network version, as well as a local version with several user profiles), an expanded dialogue will be offered at the first launch to register in the system.
Specific features of transfer from the 5.x version to Platform F1 EXPERT may be found on the page Switching over from Version 5.x.

GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT may be launched from the command line while indicating the authorisation parameters. The following parameters should be indicated after the name of the executable file garant.exe in the command line:

tr.td: The given parameter defines which User Profile should be used to log in.
The given parameter defines the password to log in using the selected User Profile.

topic.p:
Example:
"C:\Program Files\Garant\garant.exe" -F1ShellLogin "user" -F1ShellPassword "garant"
The following rules apply in this case:

ul.li: If there are no users with the entered registration name among users registered in the system, he will be registered automatically in the system. In this case, the registration name and the password must be entered as specified in the Rules of Registration in the system.

If the user with the entered registration name exists in the system, but the password does not match the entered one, a warning will appear followed by the GARANT system entry window to enter correct registration information.
If the course of the registration in the system, the password field is left empty, the -F1ShellPassword parameter may be omitted.

topic.p: This feature permits to create personal GARANT system entry shortcuts under the chosen user profile.

Immediately after you launch it, GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT will display an authorisation dialogue box. Enter login (registration name) with the password you have chosen at registration in the system or register a new user if you are a newcomer. The system will load an appropriate User Profile.

td.div: Authorisation dialogue box. The field Registration Name will load automatically the name used at the previous system entry.

topic.p: The AutoLogin function permits to omit the system entry window at subsequent program launches. The mentioned Registration Name and Password will be entered automatically. The use of the AutoLogin function is described in more detail below on the page.
Possible system entry difficulties are described on the page Solving Problems.
Maybe you are not yet registered in the system and do not have a personal login. Click the New User link and follow the instructions on the page Registration.
You can get your forgotten password to your e-mail address. For more details, see page Solving Problems.

If you check the Remember Passwordbox, your registration information will be stored in the computer memory. Later, it will be filled in automatically. The System Entry dialogue box will not be displayed.

You may happen to have the need to enter GARANT System using another name. You will have to force the dialogue box System Entry. Press the Shift key immediately after launching GARANT System while the start-up image is on the screen. The system will load the authorisation dialogue and permit to enter another registration information.
If you launch the program with the Shift key, the Password field appears to be empty. Fill in the fields with the new values you want to use later for automatic system entry.

Launching with the Shift key may also be used to remove from the computer memory the current login and password. Invoke the authorisation dialogue box and uncheck the box Remember Password. The system will stop saving your information and the AutoLogin function will be disabled. (This may be required, for example, if you hand over your computer to another user.)
You can control the AutoLogin function also by using the AutoLogin command in the File menu item. If checked, the AutoLogin function is enabled.

Each system user has his own profile where his personal information is saved. At system entry, the user fills in (manually or automatically) his login, and the system loads the appropriate profile. At exit, the user profile is saved automatically.
The profile stores the following information:

ul.li: System settings. Each user may set up the system interface and behaviour as convenient.

Window content .
Information saved in folders permits access to only one user by default and cannot be seen by other.
The history of requests and viewed documents.
Comments, added by the user in document texts. The notes in My comments folder can be seen by only the user having added them.
System status. At exit, the system saves the content and location of the opened windows and panels, entered search requests etc. They are restored the next time you enter the system.

topic.p:
In the case of the network client server option (permitting to work simultaneously from several computers connected to the system server. In the client server version, user profiles are stored on the server.)
of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT, user access to his profile is provided from any computer used to log in the system. To get access to your documents, settings and comments from another computer, it is enough to enter GARANT System using you login.

There is rule for any login: only one user with such login can work in the system at the given moment of time. In other words, working simultaneously for two users with the same login is not permitted.

In the case of the local version (permitting to work on the computer where it is installed only)
of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT, information and settings of several users working with GARANT System jointly on the same computer are saved in different profiles.
Independent registration in the system permits to create User Profile, by selecting personal login and password to enter GARANT System.

To register, press the link Register new user in the authorisation window (see ). The system will suggest filling in a number of fields while observing simple rules. You can continue after filling in all necessary fields correctly.

td.div: Registration dialogue box

ul.li: The fields Login and Password must not be longer than 32 characters.
The fields Login and Password may contain any characters entered from the keyboard except for the space.
The fields Login and Password may be identical.
The fields Password and Confirm Password must be identical.
Obligatory for filling are only the fields New Registration Name and the User Full Name.

The Login and Password will be used further for system entry. They should saved properly.
If you want to safeguard you information in GARANT System (folders, comments) against unauthorised access, do not choose too short or evident Password for system entry. Do not use your name, e-mail or computer address, as well as simple combinations like "123" or "qwerty".

li.p: An informative User Name will make you recognisable for the system administrator. Use can use, for example, your full name.

The e-mail address is necessary for automatic restoration of the lost registration information. Forgotten login and password will be sent to the given e-mail address in reply to the special request described on the page Solving Problems.
It is highly recommended to indicate your e-mail address (if available).

topic.p: If all of the fields are filled in correctly, the Register button will become available. Press it to start your work with the system. A new user profile will be created with the login you entered, and the system will start loading.
If an error occurs, find the page Solving Problems.
At subsequent launches, system entry will be fulfilled as usually.

The system has a mechanism of import (transfer) of settings, folders and bookmarks saved in the home directory (the home directory in GARANT System 5.x is the folder on the hard disk where the system stores user personal information (settings, folders, bookmarks). The route to this folder is usually: C:\GARANT\USER0.)
of the user of GARANT System 5.x. This means that after loading Platform F1 EXPERT, you will continue working with the earlier selected settings, with My documents (panel) containing the earlier saved folders and bookmarks.

No special actions to import the profile from the previous GARANT System version are necessary. The import will be fulfilled automatically at registration in the system. The User Profile created at registration will inherit all information saved earlier during your work with GARANT System 5.x.
However, in individual cases, it is necessary to indicate which of the old profiles should be imported. Such necessity emerges if the computer has more than one profiles of GARANT 5.x users.

Let us remind you that GARANT System 5.x also had a mechanism of saving profiles. Settings of different users working with the system on the same computer were stores independently. Description of work with user profiles may be found in GARANT 5.x context guide on the page Setting up the System/User Settings.
Most often, however, a single user profiles was used while working with GARANT System. It was loaded automatically at system start-up.

An expanded registration dialogue box is used to choose the profile. The left part of the dialogue box displays the list of Version 5.x profiles. Indicate the profile settings to be imported to the newly created profile of Platform F1 EXPERT. Enter the registration information according to the rules described on the page Registration.

td.div: Expanded registration dialogue contains the list of profiles created in the course of work with GARANT System 5.x. Choose the profile settings to be imported to the Platform F1 EXPERT profile.

topic.p: At the next system entry, the 5.x profile selected by you will be marked as already imported.
If you do not want to import existing 5.x settings at registration, choose item New User from the list. As a result, a new profile with be created with the default settings.
You work with GARANT System is finished as usually - by closing the program main window or by the Exit command. When quitting, all information is saved automatically comprising the User Profile.
The next remark pertains to the users of the network version of GARANT System.

If you close the window, the session of user with the current login will be over. This means that there is an opportunity to enter the system with the same login from another computer where GARANT System is installed.
Let us remind you that only one user can use the profile associated with the particular login any moment of time. Simultaneous work of two users with the same login is impossible. Hence, if you leave your operator position and plan to enter GARANT System from another computer, it is necessary first to close GARANT System on the current computer.
You may encounter the following difficulties at system entry.

sel.font: You forget your registration information (login and password).

li.p: Use the password reminder function. In the dialogue box of System Entry click Forgot Password. A window will be displayed where you should enter your e-mail address you have indicated at registration in GARANT System. If this e-mail is present in the list of registered system users, your registration information will be sent to it.

sel.font: The system reports that the login is already in use.

li.p: The report means that somebody entered GARANT System from another computer using your login and password. Let use remind you that each login is associated with the user profile where his personal information is saved. To avoid conflicts, the system blocks simultaneous work of several users with the same profile.
System entry with your login is impossible until the other user works with GARANT System.

sel.font: The system reports that the login already exists.

li.p: At registration, you entered a new login that matches the one registered earlier. You have to repeat the registration and choose another login.
Maybe the registered login is yours, but you do not remember the appropriate password and cannot enter the system. Use the Password Reminder function.

topic.p: The section describes navigation through the system pages.
It describes the work with the Navigation Panel and lists the tabs it contains.
Examines the Main Menu items used to invoke all key system functions, including the Legal Navigator.
Opportunities of returning to the previous screens in the course of your work with the system are examined on the page Navigation History.

The Navigation Panel is placed by default in the left part of the system main window and contains a dynamic ( the number and composition of tabs may change depending on the task content. The necessary tabs are opened automatically, the unnecessary ones are closed. )
set of tabs to access various system functions.

Depending on the task content, the following tabs may appear on the panel: Menu, Document structure, Wordings, Flagged documents, My documents (panel), Filters and the Configuration. The current tab is highlighted white, making it clearly different from the inactive tabs. When the mouse pointer is placed on any of the inactive tabs, its name is underlined.

td.div: Navigation panel. Switching between the pages is done using the tabs. You can change the panel width, hide it, wrap it and expand.

topic.p: Not all of the tabs are present permanently on the navigation panel. Most of them appear only when you work with certain objects. To avoid overcharging of the navigation panel, such tabs are hidden automatically when you switch over to other pages. For example, 1) the filters tab is shown when you work with the document list, 2) the tab with the document contents is vital only when looking through the document text, and 3) the tab with the document wordings appears if amendments are available in the given document.
Any of the tabs may be hidden using the cross button in the tab's right upper corner. To return the hidden tab, you have to invoke the command of the same name from the system main window.
Other operations with the navigation panel are described on the page Panel Control.
The system envisages numerous tools to control the navigation panel. You can arrange your desktop as convenient through the following manipulations.

ul.li: Width change. It is done with your mouse by dragging the separator between the panel and the system main window.
Panel wrapping. Use the arrow in the upper right part of the panel: . Click anew on the arrow or any of the panel tabs to unwrap the panel.

Turning the AutoWrap on. Press the button in the left upper part of the panel: . The AutoWrap regime is on. The panel will wrap automatically when the mouse pointer is off the panel and will unwrap if the mouse pointer is on the panel tabs.
Switching over to floating regime. Drag the panel heading (double-bar separator in the panel upper part) with your mouse anywhere on the screen. The panel will detach and assume the floating regime.

td.div: The floating navigation panel moving freely over the desktop. The panel may be re-attached to the GARANT System main window by dragging its heading to the left or right window edge.

ul.li: Partial floating regime. Drag the necessary tab in the left part of the panel with your mouse anywhere on the screen. The appropriate page will detach and assume the floating regime. You can attach and detach the pages as you wish combining them with each other.

Attaching to the right edge. Drag the panel heading (or one of the tabs) with your mouse to the right edge of the main window. Release the mouse button when the pointer is right over the edge. The panel will attach to the right edge. Thus, the panel tabs may be placed left or right fully or partly.

td.div: Placing the navigation panel tabs on different edges of the program main window.

ul.li: Turning word wrap on. The names of some elements of the list tree structures (some elements enclosed in other) exceed the width of the visible part of the panel. The full name of such element may be in the screentip or if you expand the panel width, which is not always convenient. If you use the Word wrap command of the panel context menu, you can turn the word wrap regime on so that element names fit in the window width automatically.

td.div: The word wrap is off in the left panel and on in the right one.

topic.p: The Task Bar is a new interface element having accumulated the system's professional features for working with any object (document, list, search). The Task Bar is invoked using the button of the main toolbar or the Task bar command, which is a tab on the Navigation Panel, listing as hyperlinks the main commands applicable to the object opened in the main window.

td.div: Main Menu task bar.

topic.p:
The Task Bar consists of two sections:
The one having grouped operations with the object loaded in the main window. Depending on the object, there are the following sections and their content (by default):
Object Description
Search by details
Search by keywords
Search by source of publication
Review of changes in the legislation
Section Request Save to My documents...
Load from My documents...
History
Enable filter
Document list Section List Refine list
Sort
Enable filter
Document text Section Document
Show wordings
Show graphic image of official source
Show/hide excerpts
Correspondents
Respondents
Main Menu
Query card to online legal support service
Advice text
Text of review of changes in the legislation
Show graphic image of object in document
Print preview
Term interpretation in dictionary
Section Personal Choose configuration
Configuration settings...
Style editor...
Section Explorer containing links to the main system sections that are requested most often: Main menu
My Documents
Flagged documents
PRIME. My Newsreel
My Advice
Work Log
Dictionary The content of the Explorer section is the same for all panels.

The Main Menu is the list of links to invoke the key functions and data sections of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT. The content of the main menu is determined by the Main Menu View parameter of the current configuration. By default, the Simple main menu view corresponds to the Main Configuration, and the Advanced one, to the Extended Configuration.

The Simple Main Menu includes the following sections:
Expanded search
Business references
Online legal support
Recent documents
Picture 21
Simple view of the Main Menu.

The Advanced Main Menu includes the following sections:
Legal navigator
Recent documents
Reference
Search, as well as the Online Legal Advice command to invoke the query card to the Online Legal Advice Service.

td.div: Advanced view of the Main Menu.

topic.p: The Advanced system menu is also present in the form of the navigation panel tab.

td.div: Main Menu tab.

topic.p:
The view on the tab is different from the advanced window presentation thanks to the presence of the Configuration and Set information commands, as well as the absence of the lists of recent documents and requests generated in each type of search.
To invoke the tab, use the Menu (panel) command. The window is invoked by the Main menu command.
The following search tools are included in the Main Menu extended block:

ul.li:
Search by details is a fine search tool for document search using the known details.
As a result of the search, the system produces a list of documents with details matching exactly the ones entered when filling in the search from.

Search by keywords is an intellectual search mechanism that does not require the knowledge of document details. It is enough to choose a practical situation under consideration or a an aspect of legal relations.
The system will generate a list of documents regulating relations in the specified situation. The list elements will contain a reference to the appropriate norms.

topic.p: The Business references section of the Main Menu contains links to the groups of reference documents that are requested most often, such as the codes, accountant calendars, typical forms and other reference materials.

ul.li: Codes of the Russian Federation. The list of codes of the Russian Federation forming part of our databank.

Рroduction calendar.
The links in calendars permit to switch over directly to the texts of the normative documents regulating this or that payment.

Other business references. Often used information of economic and legal nature collected in one location. The Business References section contains a production calendar, forms of tax and accounting reports, dynamics of changes of the minimum amount of labour remuneration, foreign exchange rates of the Central Bank and the rates of refinancing, guide of bank identification codes and other thematic sets of information.
For example, the minimum amount of labour remuneration changed a dozen times in the recent eyras, which required as many normative acts to change it. You have to find and study all these documents to track the dynamics of changes of the minimum amount of labour remuneration. The presence of an appropriate business inquiry information simplifies significantly the given task.

topic.p: The given section of the Main Menu provides all tools for work with the Online Legal Advice Service.

ul.li: Question to an expert - opens the Query card to the Online Legal Advice Service.
Look up replies - opens in the Navigation Panel the tab My Documents with the open My Advice folder to browse the received advice.
Rules of work - opens the page Rules of Work with the Online Legal Support Service of the present guide.

topic.p: The search block of the Main Menu includes the following search tools:

ul.li:
Search by Details is a fine search tool for document search using the known details.
As a result of the search, the system produces a list of documents with details matching exactly the ones entered when filling in the search from.

Search by keywords is an intellectual search mechanism that does not require the knowledge of document details. It is enough to choose the practical situation under consideration or an aspect of legal relations.
The system will generate a list of documents regulating legal relations in the given situation. The lest elements will contain a reference to the appropriate norms.

topic.p: A list of recent user requests is produced for each type of search. The length of the list is defined in the Interface Settings section of the Configuration Settings window.

Legal Navigator is a mechanism providing access to any document connected to the system. Depending on the type of information, the Legal Navigator is divided into branches containing documents, court rulings, international treaties, comments, draft laws and document forms.

td.div: Working with Legal Navigator. The Documents section is active.

topic.p: The Navigator is a hierarchy of sections where the documents are grouped by the norms of law or other features. The basis of the given structure is the classifier of GARANT System legal information. The documents touching on more than one norm are placed in several sections simultaneously.

The search through the Navigator implies a consecutive refining of the branch of the legislation that is of interest to you. Each subsequent step restricts the search area: while the upper sections of the Navigator correspond to more general areas of legal regulation, the lower ones refer to its very restricted areas - particular norms of legislation. The latter are marked with a special sign. When you switch over to such section, the system displays a list of correspondents or their particular parts regulating the given legal relations.

Visually, the Navigator is present in two equivalent views shown in the illustration: a tree (the tree (hierarchy) structure formed by the folders enclosed in each other. )
(on the Navigation Panel) and a "flat" one (in the Main Window). The first presentation permits to unfold and eye all levels of the classifier, the second one shows only the content of one level. Both of them may be used in your work.
To facilitate the finding of the necessary section in the Navigator tree, the Context Filter is envisaged.
Below is an overview of the rout sections of the GARANT System Legal Navigator.

ul.li: All documents. A full list of all documents without dividing into individual types of legal information.
Acts of the bodies of power. Legal acts issued by the bodies of the legislative and executive power of the Russian Federation and the subjects of the Russian Federation.

Cases. Decisions of the Constitutional Court, Higher Arbitration Court of the Russian Federation, Supreme Court of the Russian Federation, federal arbitration courts of districts and courts of subjects of the Federation. This information is necessary not only for professional lawyers but also for all involved in conclusion of contracts and regulation of disputes. It is not always possible to determine unambiguously the procedure of application of the normative act. In such situations, one needs a selection of judicial practices serving as a guide for the application of the norms of law.

International agreements. This section includes conventions, declarations, international pacts, multilateral and bilateral treaties of Russia with other countries, including the countries of the Commonwealth of Independent States. International agreements ratified by the laws of the Russian Federation form an integral part of its legal system.
According to the Constitution, the norms of the international law are prevailing over the norms of the internal legislation. Thus, if an accountant studies the issues of taxation of transactions with foreign legal entities, he will need not only the texts of the Russian normative acts, but also appropriate documents of the international law (for example, on avoidance of double taxation).

Projects of laws. The draft laws in this section are accompanied by explanatory notes of their authors making it clear what is expected by the legislator as a result of adoption of this or that law. Besides, the system tracks the history of each draft law from the moment of introduction to the moment of signing as recorded in the draft law file.

Forms of documents. Typical forms of document in various formats (txt, Word, Excel): contracts, proxies, forms of accounting, tax and statistical reports endorsed by the state bodies. It includes also the forms of contracts drawn up by Garant Company lawyers.

topic.p: The Reference section of the Main Menu accumulates news and reviews of the legislation, business inquires, accountant tax calendar, as well as information on the new documents and hot information on the services.

ul.li:
Business references. Often used information of economic and legal nature collected in one location. The Business References sections contains production calendar, forms of tax and accounting reports, dynamics of changes of the minimum amount of labour remuneration, foreign exchange rates of the Central Bank and the rates of refinancing, guide of the bank identification codes and other thematic sets of information.
For example, the minimum amount of labour remuneration changed a dozen times in the recent years. The same number of normative acts was adopted to change it. You have to find and study all these documents to track the dynamics of changes of the minimum amount of labour remuneration. The presence of the appropriate business inquiry simplifies this work significantly.
The monitoring of the legislation is an overview of the most significant changes in the legislation for the most recent 6 weeks, as well as information on the new facts in the analytical information blocks. The list of documents is divided by subjects. The most important documents are marked with the Attention! remark .

Accountant calendar contains tax calendars of the federal and regional levels indicating the deadlines to pay the taxes and submit reports to the tax bodies in compliance with the legislation.
The links in the calendar permit to switch over directly to the texts of the normative documents regulating this or that payment.

New documents: List of documents connected to the system, as well as amended or invalidated ones in the recent 6 weeks. In the case of the daily update of the databank, the document lists are provided for the recent days of the current week and preceding 5 weeks.

Hot information: Information of the new and existing information products and services for GARANT System users, as well as the addresses and telephone numbers of the Garant Company and its regional partners.

topic.p: This section of the Main Menu contains links to the recent documents opened by the given user in the current or previous sessions. The number of links is defined in the Interface Settings section of the Configuration Settings window.

The specific feature of work with the hypertext reference legal system is an often need to return to the previous stages both in the current and in the previous sessions. You may need to roll back one or more steps any moment of time in the current session: to the text of the certain document, list or query card to refine the search details.

In the course of your work, GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT automatically generates the navigation history in the current work session. It includes all screens loaded in the system Main Window: Navigator sections, lists, document texts, query cards and so on.
Switching over between the wordings of the same document is also registered in the navigation history. Besides, viewed documents and requests in each type of search are also registered in the Work Log.

td.div: GARANT System navigation history. The drop down list lists the pages earlier loaded in the system Main Window.

li.p: You can roll back to any screen saved in the navigation history. No need to switchover step by step: the system permits to choose any of the viewed screens from the special list.

After rolling back, you can return to the previous page. You can move forward through the navigation history until another page is loaded above the current one. In this case, the whole of the following navigation history is deleted by the new record.

topic.p: History.

The Work Log is found on My Documents panel, which is an archive of viewed documents and requests in all types of search and generated in all user sessions during the specified number of days. The number of days is specified in the Interface Settings section of the Configuration Settings window.
You can switch over to the Work Log using the Work Log command of the upper View menu item or the main Toolbar.

td.div: Work Log. Structure.

topic.p:
The logbook is filled using the principle:
the record of the document is entered after its viewing is over
the record of the request request is entered after the list is generated for this request
the section "as of the current date" is displayed with the first record (document or request) of the section

Any document or request from the logbook may be placed in folders. To do it, you have to choose the record (document or request) with the left mouse button and drag it, while holding the button depressed, to the place you need (the rout directory or any subdirectory of My Documents folder) .
You can clear the Work Log using the Clear Work Log command from the Work Log shortcut menu of My Documents panel.

The section includes descriptions of the types of search available in the system:
Basic search,
Search by details,
Search by keywords,

Basic search is a principally new feature for legal systems - one string search. In contrast to traditional search cards, there is no need to look for the necessary field to enter this or that document detail - it is enough to write in one line any known information on the document or situation under consideration, and GARANT System will determine which documents answer the posed question most perfectly.
Working with the Basic Search is as close as possible to the use of usual Internet search servers that do not cause any difficulties (Yandex, Rambler, Google and other).

td.div: Basic Search panel in the Main Menu.

topic.p: The Basic Search panel is a tool consisting of the query line and information type tabs to restrict the Basic Search area. Besides, the panel carries an interactive example to place the sample text in the entry line and a link to the Rules of Work with the Basic Search.

You can choose the task to solve using the search area switches appearing on the Basic Search panel while you are in the list or document. Thus, while you are in the list, you can execute a quick search over the whole databank (switch Anywhere), refine the current list by executing a Context Search in the document texts (switch In the list) or refine the current list by executing a Context Search in the document names (switch In the list document names).

td.div: Basic Search panel in the document text.

topic.p:
When invoked from the document text, the search area switches suggest choosing between the new search throughout the whole of the databank (the Anywhere item) and the context search in the opened document (the Given Document item).
Picture 29
Basic Search panel in the document text.

The choosing of the Document Names prerequisite (in the list) or the Given Document one (in the document) may be done using the key combination Ctrl+F. Besides, when you choose one of these conditions, the information type tabs are not available since they do not affect the context search.

Search by details is a fine search tool permitting to find documents using information on the document known to you (or suggested). It permits to combine in the request various information: type and number of the document you need, issuing body and the date of adoption, publication or registration in the Ministry of Justice, words or word combinations present in the document text and many other details.

Each document is characterised by the main details ( including mainly the official characteristics available in its text: type, body/source, section/subject, date of adoption, number, document text and its name (Context field). ) and the
extended ones ( "figured out" as a rule on the basis of signs and circumstances external to the document text: date of registration in the Ministry of Justice, registration number, registration status, significance, status, type of legal information, covered territory, datablock. )
specified as the search conditions.
To fulfil document search by details, press F7 key or the Search by Details button on the toolbar.

The system will load the Query Card. Fill in the card fields with the search details known to you. To start searching, press OK or use the keys Ctrl+Enter. As a result, a list of documents will be generated.

If no documents are found meeting the search criteria, the system will show a warning suggesting to apply for advice to the Online Legal Advice Service. If you press the Online Legal Support button, the values of the failed search will be entered automatically in the text of the question to the Online Legal Advice Service.

td.div: Search-by-details query card. No need to fill all card fields - the request may include any combination of search conditions.

topic.p: Description of the query card, search details and appropriate entry fields may be found in sections Query Card and Search Details.

The page Drawing up Requests contains recommendations of developers on the drawing up of search requests. A quick, precise and efficient search is possible only if the request is thoroughly prepared. Mistakes may bring about a zero or useless result.
Sample requests illustrate the use of various details in the document search.

The query card consists of a set of entry fields to enter the search conditions, which is a filled card field, their multitude forming the search request. As a result, a list of documents is produced satisfying all entered criteria simultaneously.
The following illustration shows control elements of the query card. The illustration is followed by the numbered comments to all shown elements.

td.div: Control elements of the Search-by-Details query card.

ol.li:
Section Wrapping.
The fields of the query card are divided into four sections representing:
Context search
Main details
Registration in the Ministry of Justice
Extended details To save the screen space, unused sections may be wrapped.
In this case you cannot wrap the section by chance if at least one field is filled in: the Wrap button of such section is blocked, and all filled fields are always in front of you.

Search Condition.
The search condition is any of the filled fields of the query card. The values may be entered using any of the following methods:
enter manually (item 4),
choose from the drop down list (item 5) or
from the special selection window (item 9).
Some details envisage also a logical condition that may accompany the given value while searching. The sign of the logical condition is placed on the left of the entry field.

Logical Condition.
This button indicates and switches the logical condition accompanying the search. By clicking on the button with the mouse, you can toggle the logical condition between
OR, AND and NOT.
For hierarchy vocabulary details (type, body, section, territory, source), a variable OR is suggested by default. For linear details, this condition is fixed and may not be changed by the user.
If you are not familiar enough with the logical search conditions, leave this button unchanged.
For more details, see: Logical Conditions.

Entry Field.
Details may be entered directly in the query card. When you begin, a screentip appears - drop down list of choice. It will contain the details beginning with the characters you enter.
No need to enter the necessary string to the end. To select the value from the drop down list, move the highlight with the arrow keys on the keyboard and press Enter or use your mouse. Selected value will appear in the entry field.
For more details, see: Entering Values.

Drop Down Selection List.
The list is used to select the necessary detail. When you open the list manually, it shows all details available in the database.
Note that the length of the list may be changed. It is enough to pull the lower right corner of the list with the mouse.

Removing the Condition.
The Delete button clears the appropriate search condition and removes the entry field from the query card.
If the removed condition is the last one for the given detail (the only one), the entry field is cleared but not removed.

Adding a Condition.
The search request may include a free number of conditions for one and the same detail (for example, a list of several possible types or issuers of search documents simultaneously).
For this purpose, you can use the button Add new. If you press the button, an additional entry field appears opposite the appropriate detail.
The Add button is not always visible. It appears when at least one field is filled for the detail. Besides, some details (date(date), context search area (where to find context), date of registration in the Ministry of Justice (date of registration))
have only one entry field.

Date Selection Calendar.
The dates may be entered manually and by means of an electronic calendar. The calendar is invoked with the button on the right of the date entry field.

Selection Window.
Nearly all details of the query card envisage opportunities of selection of values from the special selection window.
Click with your mouse on the link naming the necessary detail. A separate window will appear showing the list of all available values of this detail.
In contrast to the selection list, this window supports quick switching to the necessary value from the keyboard, group folder wrapping/unwrapping, context list filtering and other useful functions.
For more details, see: Choosing the Values.

Start Searching.
If the you press the button OK Ctrl+Enter , the system starts to process the entered request. The search may take from fractions of a second to several minutes depending on the complexity of the task. Context search is especially time consuming.
At the end of the search, the system will report the number of documents found and suggest to display their list on the screen.

Clearing the Card.
The Clear command removes all entered search conditions, i.e. clears all fields of the query card. The search request is empty. If you initiate an empty request, the system will produce the list of all documents available in the current databank.
If the query card contains simultaneously new and previous conditions, the result will be distorted. Therefore, it is recommended to clear the card each time before compiling a new search request.

topic.p: The above paragraph describes how to clear the current card to enter other search conditions in it. Instead, you can load a new copy of the query card by pressing F7 again or . The system will load an empty card, and the previously filled one will be saved in the Navigation History. Later, you can return to it using the Back command.

The system will remember not only the previous query cards. It will automatically save also the requests processed in the current session. When you choose the necessary request from the drop down History list, the fields of the current card will be filled immediately with conditions of the chosen request.
Besides, requests may be saved in folders. The saved requests may be invoked, edited and processed anew not only in the current, but also in subsequent GARANT System sessions.

Any detail may be entered directly in the query card without opening a separate selection window. The system will track correctness of entry. The entered string is compared in the process of entry with the detail values from the database, securing against any mistakes.

Place the cursor in the entry field and begin typing the detail value. A drop down list will appear matching the initials of the entered text. The list will become shorter as soon as the new characters are entered.

td.div: Quick entry of search conditions.

topic.p: If the next entered character appears to be a mistake, the whole of the entered text becomes red. Further text entry is blocked. All characters typed on the keyboard will be written over the erroneous one until any permitted character appears.
To select the necessary element from the drop down list, move to it with the up and down arrows and press Enter. Selected value will be added in the entry field.
The drop down selection list may also be opened manually. To force the list open, use your mouse or the key combination Ctrl+. Such list will show all detail values available in the database.

tr.td: Choosing the necessary value from the drop down list. The value is added in the entry field.
Closing the drop down list while removing the entered characters. If the field was not empty before typing, the previous field value is restored.
Navigation through the list of suitable values.
Highlighting the most recent entered characters in the entry field. With subsequent text entry, the highlighted characters are deleted.
Highlighting the most recent entered words. If you press the arrow, the whole word is selected.
Removing selected characters in the entry field.
Folder wrapping and unwrapping in the drop down list.

topic.p: The checking is fulfilled for the fields of all vocabulary details. There is a special dictionary of permitted values for each of them - i.e. those present in at least one document of the database. It is evident that if any other value is entered, no documents will be found. Therefore, the program blocks entry of values other than those included in the appropriate selection dictionary.

The rest of the query card details - Date, MOJ Date and Context - are not the vocabulary ones, since it makes no sense to list in the dictionaries the whole range of conceivable dates, words, word forms or word combinations. Therefore, you can enter any values (while observing the specified format; see below). The entered conditions will be analysed later while processing the search request.
There is a number of particulars of filling of certain query card fields. The details may be found in the description of the appropriate details:

tr.td: Symbol "*" may replace an unknown number ending.

The context field may be used to enter letters, digits and a certain set of other symbols. You can enter phrases fixing the necessary word order. There is a word search regime omitting flections (exclamation sign).

Date of Adoption,
Date of MOJ Registration
The date entry format is dd.mm.yyyy. The year may be indicated in short. The latter of the dates may not be earlier than the former one. Selection of dates from the electronic calendar is supported.

topic.p: For work with several values of the vocabulary detail, there is a special Selection Window.

The window is separated into two parts. The upper part contains the selection dictionary, i.e. all detail values available in the current database. The lower part of the window shows the list of selected values - those marked in the selection dictionary.

td.div: Section/Subject vocabulary detail window consists of the dictionary of values (top) and the list of selected values (bottom).

topic.p:
The dictionary is a hierarchy or a linear list of values to be selected for searching. To select the value, mark it with your mouse,
Ins key or the toolbar button depicting the mark.
Only the mark may be used for the elements of linear lists . Elements of hierarchy lists, including the folders, may be marked with various logical conditions: , or .

If the list of values is too big, you can find the necessary value using the Context Filter. The context filter entry field is directly above the selection list. Enter the substring to be found in the searched list element. This may be a word combination, separate word or even a word fragment - the entered letters or digits must be found in the searched element, not necessarily in the beginning. The selection list will contain only those values containing the entered substring.

You can mark several list elements simultaneously. Pre-select them using the keys Ctrl or Shift and arrows , (or the mouse), operating them ( If you hold Ctrl key depressed, you can select elements without unselecting other already selected elements. The pressing of the Shift key permits to select a group of elements in the given rage simultaneously. )
as if working in the Windows Explorer. After you press one of the logical condition signs on the toolbar, all selected elements will be marked with the same sign.
To quickly remove all marks, use the Clear button or the key combination Ctrl + Del.
The list contains the values marked in the selection dictionary.

If you use the lower list, you can easily find in the selection dictionary the value marked earlier. When you select the element in the list of selected values (for example, with your mouse), its corresponding element in the selection dictionary becomes selected either. If necessary, you can unwrap the parent folders and scroll through the dictionary to find this value.
You can use the Del key to remove the elements from the lower list. Such removal will unmark the appropriate element in the selection dictionary and vice versa.
The full list of commands of the selection window is provided on the page Search: Detail Selection.

The search logical condition is introduced with the button located opposite the detail value entered for searching. You can toggle the condition if you press the button. The default value is . The first pressing changes the sign into , the second, into . The third pressing will return the default value.

td.div: Changing the logical condition in the query card.

topic.p: The logical condition defines the way the entered detail value is included in the set of properties of the searched document. Depending on the condition, the detail value entered in the request may be a) desirable b) obligatory or c) prohibited for the searched document.

ul.li:
Logical condition OR before the detail value means that the searched document must have at least one value out of those entered for the given detail with such condition.
In other words, the search will select the documents that have in their properties one or several detail values entered with condition OR.

Logical AND opposite the detail value means that the searched document must be characterised by the given value on the unconditional basis regardless of the other conditions.
Thus, the document must satisfy all such conditions separately.

Logical NOT means that the searched document must not have the specified value in its properties.
In other words, search results will exclude all documents possessing such value.

topic.p: Logical conditions may be changed for the values of all hierarchy vocabulary details. The values of the linear details, however, are always marked with the condition , that cannot be changed.

Let us examine a number of examples other than from practical work to illustrate the impact of logical conditions on the search results. The examples consist of the search request and its vocabulary meaning. You can repeat these examples or try your own, more significant in your practice.
In all examples, the search conditions are specified for the document type detail. The demonstration database consists of 21,202 documents.

tr.td:
All decisions available in the database. (Some of them may be also of another type simultaneously, i.e. are not only decisions.)
The result: 5,400 documents.

All decisions and regulations available in the database. (Some regulations may also be attachments to part of decisions.)
The result: 6,100 documents.

All decisions containing in its text a regulation.
The result: 800 documents.

All decisions that do NOT have attached regulations.
The result: 5,399 documents.

All documents of the database that are NOT being decisions.
The result: 15,800 documents.

topic.p: The query card consists of the following search details.

td.p:
If you use the given context search field, you can find documents of which the text ( In addition to the main document text, the search will also include legal comments added by developers of GARANT System. User added comments are not included. )
contains certain words or word combinations.

Enter one or several words separated with spaces. The search will select documents meeting your request where all words mentioned by you are present simultaneously.
The words should be entered in full.
To find all words satisfying the entered text template, add symbol <*> at the end. For example, for the text tax*, the documents will be found containing such word forms as tax, taxable, and taxation etc.
In the context field, you may enter letters, digits, space < > and hyphen <->; exclamation sigh <!> and the asterisk <*> may be used only at the end of the word, i.e. all symbols after them to the space are ignored while searching; symbols </>, <.> may be used only to separate digits; the rest of the symbols may not be used in the context search.
See recommendations on the filling of the context fields.

tr.td: If you use the given context search field, you can find documents of which the names contain certain words and their derivatives. The rules of filling of the field are the same as the ones for the field Words in the Text.

td.p: The type of searched document (law, decision..). Most often, the document is of one type which is evident from its name.

There are documents of more than one type. For example, the main documents may include as attachments regulations, programs, formulae etc. Such document will contain several types. Thus, document type Decision may include one or several Regulations. See examples.

The name of the legislative body having adopted the searched normative act, or the source having published the non-normative document of consulting nature. The name of the issuer is usually found in the document name.

The document may have more than one issuer. Such joint documents include, for example, regulations, letters and directions of the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation, Central Bank of Russia and other bodies of power.
The selection dictionary of the bodies of power often use as their names both commonly accepted abbreviations. Some acronyms also contain their full names.
This field suggests the subject of the searched document, i.e. location in the classifier of legal information. The given classifier of the norms of law is applied in the system Legal Navigator.
If only individual sections, articles, items, paragraphs of the document satisfy search conditions, rather than the whole document, such document will also be included in the search results.
A correct indication of the norm of law will speed up the complex search and, most important, will make the results more accurate.
Number of searched document.
The same number may imply several documents adopted in different time by different bodies of power. On the contrary, jointly adopted documents may have several numbers.

Instead of the number ending, you can use special symbol * to replace the unknown ending. Thus, if you use mask 221*, the documents will be found bearing the numbers 221, 221-94, 221-P, 2216/98 and so on.
Date of adoption of the document by the body of power. If there several issuing bodies, the document may have more than one dates of adoption. All available dates are included.

The query card contains two fields to enter dates: date From:
and the date To: .
This permits to enter both the exact date of adoption and the range of time - either open or closed. Let us list the options:

tr.td: Both fields are filled; the date in both fields is the same.
Both fields are filled; the dates in the fields are different.
Documents adopted beginning with the first date and ending with the second, including the mentioned dates themselves.
The field "From:" is filled, and the field "To:" is empty.
Documents adopted after the date "From:" inclusive. The upper date is not restricted.
The field "From:" is empty, and the field "To:" is filled.
Documents adopted before the date "To:" inclusive. The lower date is not restricted.

td.p: The date should be typed form the keyboard in format dd.mm.yyyy or selected using the electronic calendar. If typed from the keyboard, the day, month and year may be entered in short using any number of digits in the appropriate fields. Incomplete day and month values will be supplemented with a leader zero. Incompletely filled year number will be supplemented with the leader digits to obtain the value as close as possible to the current year, however, not greater than it.
The system will watch the correctness of the entered date requiring to observe the specified format and adherence to the calendar of possible dates.

tr.td: Details of Registration in the Ministry of Justice

td.p: The date of the document state registration. The field is filled using the same rules as the date of adoption.
Document state registration number. Each registered document has its own, unique registration number. The field is filled using the same rules as the number.

The status of state registration ( Registration applies to the acts pertaining to rights, liberties and duties of man and citizen or those of interagency nature adopted by the federal bodies of executive power; acts specifying the legal status of organisations and a number of other categories of documents. )
of the normative legal act in the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation as of the date of update of the databank. According to the status of registration, the documents may include:

ul.li: registered ones
those that were denied registration
other, i.e. not pertinent

td.p: Document significance is determined by the circle of persons involved.

li.p: Common documents are those of multiple use involving the multitude of persons covered by the regulated situation. The commonly significant documents may be both normative and non-normative legal acts. Thus, letters of the Ministry of Taxation explaining the actual legislation on taxes are the acts of common significance that are not included in the normative ones.
Personal ones are non-normative acts involving particular persons, events, objects and legal relations of a single-use nature.

td.p: Thу status of effectiveness of the document as of the date of update of the databank. According to the status, the documents may include:

ul.li: those in effect

not being in effect:
having lost their force
not yet entered into force

td.p: The type of legal information where the searched document is included (official legal documents, judicial and arbitration practices, document forms ...). The type of document is determined by its inclusion in one of the larger sections of the Legal Navigator.
Specifies the territory covered by the body having issued the searched document.
When you search the documents, you can choose one or several datablocks included in the current set.

topic.p: The expanded details section also includes an optional parameter Search in Invalid Document Wordings specifying whether you should include different document wordings in your search.
Below is the classification of search details by the type of their values.

The values of the vocabulary detail may not be specified on the arbitrary basis, they must be chosen from the special dictionary containing all possible values of the given detail. Even if entered manually in the query card, the system will check the presence of the entered value in the database.
