If you make a mistake at entry, a system sound is played as soon as the entered sequence of characters no longer meets the available details, and the entered values are painted red not permitting to continue the entry.

Such approach excludes opportunities of errors in the requests. For example, it is impossible to enter the type of document which is not available in the database - you can only select one or several types actually present in it.
The dictionary is a linear or hierarchy list. Both dictionary types use one and the same selection window making it simpler to work with the query card.

li.p: A linear list is a list of equally significant detail values. The values follow each other without nesting.

td.div: View of the linear vocabulary attribute using the document number as an example.

li.p: Linear details include:

A hierarchy list is a tree structure with values available at different levels. The grouping values are marked with symbol . The refining values are placed in folders that, in turn, may also have an internal structure. For example, The Bodies of Judicial Power of the Russian Federation and the USSR are subdivided into
Courts of Arbitration of the Subjects of the Russian Federation, Courts of General Jurisdiction etc.
Graphic pictograms for marking are available for both the grouping and the refining values.

td.div: View of the hierarchy vocabulary attribute. Pictograms to mark the reply are available for all detail values.

li.p: Hierarchy details include

topic.p: The dates are entered in the field in format dd.mm.yyyy. The day, month and year numbers may be entered in short.
The system will check the correctness of the format, however, the value itself is not controlled. In other words, if you observe the rules of entry, you can specify any date from the past or future.
The date type is available for the following details of the query card:

The text particulars are specific to details Words in the Text and Words in the Name. The context field is used to enter text strings to find their matches in the texts or names of documents of the database.
The system permits to enter any search context within the specified rage of permitted characters.
Below are the general recommendations to draw up search requests.

Before you begin compiling a new request, do not forget to delete from the query car the particulars of the previous request using the button Clear. Let us remind you that the system will search the documents satisfying all of the entered conditions. Therefore, it is important that the fields of the query card contain only the particulars necessary at the given moment.
If the removed request is of importance and you will need to return to it later, this can be done using the History list. It saves the requests processed in the current system session.
Besides, the request that is needed in the future may be saved in the folders My documents (panel).
As a rule, it is enough to enter 2 or 3 details for a successful search. If the resulting list of documents appears too big, you can return to the query card and refine the request.
It is usually enough to indicate the number and date for an unambiguous identification of the document.
topic.h3: Enter Only the Values You Are Certain of
topic.p: Do not try to fill the query card with all details known to you, especially if you have any doubts about them. An error in one of them may result in a search failure. Therefore, indicate only those conditions you are absolutely sure of. Otherwise, use Search by Keywords or the Legal Navigator.

Enter words and phrases in full, without abbreviations, for example, "accounting reports", "exemptions from profit tax". As a result, the documents will be found containing the mentioned context in all word forms (for example, in the case of the word "tax", the words "taxes", "taxation" etc. will be found). If you want to find an exact match, put the exclamation sigh at the end "!" (for example, "tax!").
topic.h3: Particulars of Filling of Individual Fields

tr.td:
Since these details are a hierarchy, watch the folder the value is included in.
In particular, if you choose the document type, do not mix the types enclosed in section Document Forms with the types at the upper level of the list. For example, the search result for the type Order will not be the same as the search result for the type Document Form\Order. In the second case, only those documents will be found containing order forms in the text.
For the bodies of power, it is important to control the covered territory of the marked body of power (regional or federal).
If you do not know exact particulars of these details for the necessary document, but suggest several possible options, list all options with the mark .
Use symbol "*" to replace the exact unknown number ending.

Date of adoption,
Date of registration in the Ministry of Justice
Remember the opportunity to enter a range of dates rather than the exact date.

Context search is justified when you do not know formal details of the necessary document. In such case, try to choose the set of words describing the content of the searched document accurately enough. As an alternative, it is recommended to use the Search by Keywords.
It is important to avoid mistakes in the context field, as well as use word combinations with caution. The searched words may be present in the text in a different sequence - not the one you expect.

topic.p: Save in My documents... command saves search requests in folders on the tab My documents (panel). Requests saved in such a way will be available not only in the current session, but also in subsequent ones.
The saved requests may be later fulfilled directly from folders, as well as loaded to the query card using the Load from My documents... command and edited. Besides, they may be assigned as filters.
The procedure of saving of requests in folders is described on the page Saving in Folders.
Examples demonstrating opportunities of Search by Details.

1. Find all letters of the Ministry of Taxation of the Russian Federation for year 2002 on the profit tax (Let us fill in the fields Document Type "Letter", Body "Ministry of Taxation", Section "Taxes and fees/Types of taxes and dues/Tax on profit of organisations", dates From "01.01.2002" To: "01.01.2003"). Generate the list.
2. Find Instruction of the State Tax Service No. 33 (Let us fill the fields Document type "Instruction", Body "State Tax Service" (may be omitted) and No. "33"). Generate the list.

3. Find documents adopted jointly by the State Customs Committee and the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation (Let us fill the field Body "Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation and the State Customs Committee of Russia", the list may be restricted with a date). Generate the list.
The search implies a selection from a large encyclopaedia of situations. The links from this list will direct you to the text fragments describing the subject you specified.

The encyclopaedia of situations contains references to the actual normative legal acts. Besides, the situations include bylaws and judicial practices, as well as comments by articles of legislation. The search of other analytical materials will require other system search tools: lists of Correspondents/Respondents, Legal Navigator, Search by Details or the Source of Publication.
To fulfil the Search by Keywords, press F5 or the toolbar button Search by keywords. The system will load the encyclopaedia of situations.

td.div: Encyclopaedia of situations.

topic.p: Descriptions of situations or the terms are brief formulations of particular legal subjects. Descriptions have two levels - the main and the additional ones. Descriptions of the main level express relatively broad notions, from example, "excise duty taxes" or the "profit tax". Each description of the main level is refined by subordinate descriptions of the additional level: "calculation of tax", "taxable base" etc. You can mark both the terms of the main and the additional levels.

Descriptions of the main level are shown on the left, on the navigation panel tab. The right side is used to display the full list of all descriptions including also the words of the additional level. When you choose the description, you can use any of these lists.

To switch over to the description you need, place the cursor in the window with the necessary list and begin typing the element name on the keyboard. The system will scroll the list of terms to the first marching value. To speed up the search, it is recommended to apply the context filter
As to the other features, opportunities of the list of terms are the same as those of the selection window of the vocabulary attribute. To mark the terms, you can use only condition .

The search in the encyclopaedia of situations is principally different from the context search in the document texts. The links between the description terms and the particular documents are specified manually after a thorough analysis of the legislation carried out by Garant Company lawyers.

As a result, the document found from the description of the encyclopaedia of situations may not contain, in the text, the particular words from the selected description, however, will satisfy the requested subject.
Let us emphasize that some descriptions are synonymous to each other. Thus, the same problem may be formulated differently to obtain the same results.

As in the case of any type of search, before drawing up a new request, do not forget to clear the query card. If you leave unnecessary terms, the search result will include many unnecessary documents.
Examples demonstrating opportunities of Search by Keywords.

tr.td: To quickly find all situations pertaining to the value added tax, enter in the context filter window VAT. The system will display all situations where the given abbreviation is present in the name.

sel.font: Different wordings of the same problem

tr.td: One and the same subject in the encyclopaedia of situations is formulated in different expressions. This permits to easily find the necessary situation regardless of the words used to find it. For example, the following situations are equivalent, i.e. describe the same subject: contest and tender. The search result in any case will produce the same list of documents.

Documents regulating, for example, liability for violation of currency legislation may be found in one of the following main situations Administrative Responsibility and Currency Control, by selecting in addition Liability for Violation of Currency Legislation.

sel.font: Finding a norm where the relation to the given problem is not evident

tr.td: If you generate a list of documents pertinent to the situation registration of tobacco items or certification of tobacco items or expert evaluation of low-quality tobacco items (first level situation - Tobacco, tobacco items), the system, among other documents, will find a reference to the appropriate Article of the Federal Law No. 29-FZ of January 2, 2000 on the quality and safety of foodstuffs. This is because according to Article 30 of the mentioned law, its individual provisions cover also tobacco items.

topic.p: The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.

The online legal support is a new feature for GARANT legal reference system users. In the framework of the online legal support, you can get access to two services any moment of your work with GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT:

ul.li: Hot Line of the user information and legal support where you can get operative aid while working with the system, as well as make a request to find rare legal acts.
Legal Advice permitting to apply for legal aid directly from the GARANT System to experts of the Legal Advice Service of Garant Company.

topic.p:
The procedure of getting legal support may be divided conditionally into the following stages:
Sending a request for advice.
Request processing in the Online Legal Advice Service according to the rules of rendering of the legal aid.
Getting a notification of the acceptance of the issue for processing.
Getting advice.
If you wish, you may assess the received advice. All marks are examined by the management of the Online Legal Advice Service.
To view all processed requests and received advice, switch over to the My Advice folder on the panel My Documents.

topic.h3: Rules of Work with the Online Legal Support Service
topic.p: The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found on the page What Is the Online Legal Support.

In the framework of the online legal support, you can get access to two services any moment of the your work with GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT: Hot Line of the user information and legal support and the Legal Support
In the framework of the Hot Line of the user information and legal support (forming part of the packet of standard services available to all registered users) you enjoy:

ul.li: User support on the work with GARANT System (document information, aid in searching information in GARANT System, information on the content of datablocks);
Search to personal requests of individual rare legal documents not connected to GARANT System (those that do not have dissemination restrictions).

topic.p: The Legal Support Service (requiring a separate connection) is rendered by the experts of Garant Company using the following principles:

ol.li: The issues of categories listed in Item 3 may be denied acceptance for processing. In this case, you will get a notification of the refusal to accept the issue within one working day.

topic.p: The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.

The text of the request is entered in a special card. You can switch over to it using the button Online Legal Support on the toolbar of the principle window of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT or using the key combination Alt+F1.

The subject of the request must be in compliance with the Rules of Work with the Online Legal Support Service, the text may not be greater than 6,000 characters, all fields must filled in on the obligatory basis.
To send the request to the Garant Company Online Legal Support Service, click Send Request or use the key combination Ctrl+Enter.

Besides, GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT envisages opportunities of checking operatively of the connection to the Online Legal Support Service. It is enough to use the link Check Connection to the Online Legal Support Service. As a result, a special testing request will be generated and prepared for sending automatically, which (if sent successfully) will be answered with a letter describing in detail the terms of connection to the service.

td.div: Legal support query card.

topic.p: Before sending the request, the shell will check advice service availability and if:
The request is sent to the Garant Company Online Legal Support Service and saved in folder Requests in Progress of the My Advice folder found on My Documents panel.

The reasons may be of two types:
Organisational. In this case, the request will be placed in the folder Unconfirmed, and you will be offered to apply to your servicing manager.
Technical. In this case, the request will be placed in folder Out where it will be saved until the technical problems are solved, and you will get a report that the Legal Advice Service is not available. The most common reason of technical problems is absence of Internet connection. If the reason is of another nature, apply to the Technical Support Service of your servicing organisation.
To abandon the sending of the request available in the Out folder, use the shortcut menu command Delete.

The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.
If the reply is a Legal Support service, you will get a notification of acceptance of your request for processing indicating the terms (time and cost) of the provided advice.

If the subject of the request is not in compliance with the Rules of Rendering of the Legal Support Service, instead of the notification you will get a reply of refusal of acceptance of the issue for processing.

The getting of the notification is accompanied by the special animated warning appearing in the program window (regardless of the current content) where the cursor, when placed on it, assumes the same form as in the case of a hyperlink and which, if clicked on, permits to switch you over to My Advice folder. The icon is visible until there are unsettled notifications in Requests in Progress folder.

When a notification is received, the font of the request in the folder My Advice\Requests in Progress of My Documents tab is changed from bold to ordinary one, the text of the request with the information from the notification being available for viewing in the program Main Window.

td.div: Text of the request with the notification received in reply.

topic.p: If you agree to the terms of the rendered advice, it is necessary, for getting a reply, to send confirmation to the Online Legal Support Service by selecting Yes, I Agree link in the text of the notification. If the terms are not good for you, or you do not need to get the reply any more, refuse the service by clicking on the link No, I Do Not Agree. In this case, the processing of the request will be stopped, and the request will be placed in folder My Advice\Unconfirmed.

Opportunities for users to apply for the paid advice is controlled through the system administrator interface. If you do not have the rights to apply for the legal advice service, a warning will be sent to you if you attempt to send a confirmation, suggesting to apply to the system administrator. If the administrator permits you to apply for the paid advice, your request will be accepted for processing after repeating the confirmation.

If you have any difficulties (for example, the reply is not available as expected) getting confirmation of the advice, GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT envisages opportunities to send a letter to the Technical Support Team of Garant Company. To do it, use Advice information command by pressing the key combinationCtrl+Alt+K. As a result, the system, while using your default mail program (MS Outlook Express, the Bat etc.) , will generate automatically a letter template with the necessary technical information. Enter the text of the your question while leaving advice information unchanged and simply send the letter (the address of the Technical Support Team will be filled in the field To:).

topic.h3: Control of Access to Paid Advice
topic.p: The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.
Opportunities of use of the paid advice may be restricted by the system administrator. By default, the paid advice is available to all users. By using the administrator interface, you can:

ul.li: deny getting paid advice to a particular user (in this case, he may register a new user in the system and thus get access to this service)
deny getting paid advice to all users by default (including the newly registered ones) and permit it to particular trusted users.

topic.p: If the user that was denied access to the paid advice confirms his willingness to pay for the advice in the form of the received notification, he will see that the service is not available and will be offered to apply to the system administrator. If the system administrator lifts the prohibition to get the advice for the given user, he will be able to repeat confirmation of the payment for the service.

The prohibition to get the advice through the Legal Advice Service does not affect you opportunities of getting free advice over the Hot Line of User Information and Legal Support. For more details on the differences of the services, see the Rules of Work with the Online Legal Support Service.

The features described on the given page are available for only those GARANT System users that are connected to the Online Legal Support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.
When you receive a reply from the Garant Company Legal Advice Service, the sent request will be moved automatically from folder Requests in Progress to folder Replies and marked bold.

The received advice as accompanied by a special warning icon appearing in the program window (regardless of the current content) which, when clicked on, permits to switch over automatically to My Advice folder.

td.div: Folder Replies contains unviewed advice.

topic.p: The warning will be visible over the program window until at least one unviewed advice is present in the Replies folder. Selecting of the unviewed advice will open it automatically for viewing and change the "unviewed" status.

The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.
Received advice is stored in folder My Advice\Replies of the tab My Documents. When you select the advice, the program Main Window will open the window Advice.

The advice includes the text of the request, the text of the reply and a link to the form of assessment of the received reply. If the question is in the sphere of reference of the Legal Support Service, there is also an additional organisational information (name of organisation, time when the reply is ready, complexity, account balance and information on the author of the advice) . The text of the reply may be supplemented with a list of documents available in the Additional Window on the opened List tab.

td.div: Advice supplemented with a list.

topic.p:
The list supplementing the advice may not be changed. That is if you change the list (for example, delete several documents from it) and then select the advice anew from the Replies folder, the list will be shown as received from the Online Legal Support Service. If you want to save the changes (refine, filter, add, intersect with other lists etc.)
to the list of advice, you should save it in folders and continue your work with the saved copy.

The text of the advice may not be supplemented with a user comment, however, as in the case of the text of the ordinary document of GARANT System, export operations may be applied to it. The printing of the advice from the system is fulfilled on the special form to emphasize its status.

The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.
You can assess the received advice.
Not more than one mark per advice.

Advice assessment is an important means of improvement of the legal support provided by Garant Company. Each mark is examined attentively by the management of the Online Legal Support Service and is taken into account in the further work of advising specialists.
You can switch over to the Assessment Window by clicking on the link Assess the reply in the Advice Window.

td.div: Assessment form.

topic.p: The mark may assume one of five values (not sure, excellent, good, satisfactory and unsatisfactory) , as well as may be supplemented with a comment up to 300 characters long. To send the mark to the Garant Company Online Legal Support Service, press Assess or use the key combination Ctrl+Enter.
Before sending the mark, the shell will check if the advice service is available and acts the same way as in the case of sending of the request.

The list is usually generated as a result of the search or navigation through the system Legal Navigator. The list elements are actually links to the documents loaded by the system when you open them.

In the EXPERT version, the list shows only the names of the documents. If the document has amendments, the phrase "with amendments" appears in brackets. You can view the full story of changes in the document text heading.

In some cases, you can move directly to the required document fragments - for example, those of their sections that describe the requested subject. The page List Structure describes composition of lists in more detail.

td.div: Document list.

topic.p: The List information tab at the bottom of the list shows information on the method of obtaining of the given list and subsequent operations carried out with it. This information may help you identify the origin of the list, from example, if you return to it later using the Back button.

td.div: Information on the list is show on the tab at the bottom of the window.

topic.p: The full list of commands that apply to the list of documents may be found on the guide page List. The present section provides detailed descriptions of the most important of these operations.

Special attention should be paid to the Refine list command permitting to adjust operatively the current lit using details know to you regardless of the method of obtaining (i.e. the list may be obtained as a result of the search, navigation, generation of Correspondents/Respondents etc.) of the list.

When generating the list ( the list may be obtained, for example, as a result of the search or navigation. )
it may often happen that the requested subject is not found in the whole of the document, but only in one or several of its divisions ( The division here and below implies a text fragment of a free size and nesting in the document logical structure. ) : items, chapters, articles and other document structural units. In such cases, the documents are present in the list as several, rather than single, links.
Therefore, document lists in GARANT System have an enclosed, hierarchy structure. The links to the found document divisions are "enclosed" in the name of this document.

td.div: Expanded list element. You can wrap it if you click on the sign "-" to hide the found articles.

topic.p: List documents are show differently depending on whether the whole of the document matches the requested subject or only selected document divisions.

ul.li:
Whole document match. The list contains the document name.
You will always switch over to the document beginning.

Only one or several particular divisions found. The list contains the document name with a "+" sign before it. Division names are grouped under the document name. Links to divisions have a different sign as compared to the document.
In the case of the document name, you will switch over to the beginning of the first enclosed division.
In the case of the name of the enclosed division, you will switch over to the beginning of the given division.

topic.p: If you use commands Expand all and Collapse all, you can choose a convenient list presentation: compact (links to divisions are hidden) or detailed (links to divisions are visible).

Information on the document ordinal number in the list is displayed in the Status Bar of the Principle Window as
Document Х of Y where, x is the document ordinal number in the list, and y is the total number of documents in the list. In this case, the document matches and wordings will have the same ordinal number as the document itself.

To open the current list document, click on it with your mouse or press the Enter key. The document will be loaded in the system Main Window. You can return to the list as usually by using the Back command.

td.div: GARANT System document loaded in the Main Window.

topic.p: You can open the required document in a separate window without unloading the active document list. To do it, use command Open current list in new window.

Command Open documents in excerpts is intended for the list documents that have links to particular divisions (one or several). The text of the document opened in excerpts will contain only those document divisions indicated in the links of the list.
Thus, texts in excerpts contain only selected fragments satisfying the search conditions directly. Other document divisions are not loaded on the screen.

td.div: Document opened in excerpts. The excerpts here are divisions "Item 127" and "Article 3". The active tab is warning of the loading of only selected fragments.

topic.p: The tab Document text (simultaneous view) in the lower part of the list permits to view the document simultaneously with the list itself. If you apply simultaneous list viewing, the Additional Window will show the text of the current document. If you choose another document of the list, its text is loaded in the Simultaneous View Window automatically.

Such viewing regime may be convenient, for example, for a quick document browsing. A quick examination of the texts permits to delete from the list the documents know to be unmatching and begin a thorough analysis of the remaining ones by opening them as usually one by one.

td.div: Simultaneous view regime. The tab in the Additional Window shows the abstract of the current list document. You can view any document information - its text, legal reference etc. - without leaving the list.

topic.p: The Simultaneous View Window shows all information on the current document: its text, legal reference, Correspondents/Respondents and other. To switch between the displayed information, use panel Simultaneous view. Depending on which of the buttons is pressed on the panel, the system will show either the document text or one of the reference pages (reference, Respondents ...). The choice is preserved when you switch over to another document.
The document view window shows also numerous commands: print, export, copy, work with comments etc.

Context search in the names of the documents of the current list is fulfilled using the Basic Search while switching the search area to the Names of list documents. For searching the documents texts of the current list, the switch of the search area must be set to the List.

After the necessary document is found, opened and viewed, you can switch over to the next list document. You can do it in two ways. The obvious way is to return to the list and open another document. However, it is more convenient to use for it commands in the right corner of the document Status Bar:
They permit to load "neighbouring" documents without going back to the list. To return to the list from any document, it is enough to use command Return to list.

td.div: Switching between list documents may be done using commands in the right corner of the document Status Bar.

topic.p:
If you use the Sort command, you can adjust list elements using the following criteria:
Legal force
Date of publication
Date of the most recent change
Relevance degree
Switch Sort Direction permits to specify the sorting direction: ascending or descending.

By default, the lists obtained through the context search are sorted by relevance degree in descending order. The lists obtained without the use of the context details are sorted by legal force. This means that the documents of greater legal force are found in the beginning of the list.

td.div: Tools to manage list sorting.

li.p: The legal force adjusts the documents by the degree of their importance. The basis is the document status, the position of the issuing body in the hierarchy of the bodies of power and its sphere of reference commonly adopted in the judicial practice or legislatively specified, document type and other details.
Adjustment by legal force is of recommended nature and is intended for convenience of investigation of thematic lists of documents.
If the neighbouring documents are of the same legal force, they are adjusted by the date of issue.
Date of issue is the date of adoption of the document by the issuing body.
Date of the most recent change is the date of the document actual change in GARANT System.

topic.p: The relevance degree permits to adjust the documents as far as they are close to the subject of the request. The more detailed is the description of the subject of the request in the particular document, the higher is its position in the obtained list. The basis of the search is the words in the request formula. The given type of sorting is available only for the lists obtained from the request involving context as one of the details.

Logical operations with lists permit to obtain their sum, difference or the common part of the two lists. Logical operations always involve two lists - one of them is the current one shown on the screen at the given moment and the other one must be selected by you from the list of those saved in folders.
In the below examples, the first of them is list А, which is the current one, and list B must be saved in advance in folders My Documents (panel).
Detailed descriptions of each operation are provided after the illustration.

td.div: Illustration of logical operations with lists. The grey colour depicts the resulting set of documents for operations of addition (A+B), intersection (A*B) and subtraction (A-B).

topic.p: This command permits the system to open the folder window and suggest adding the current list А with documents of the earlier saved list B. Choose from folders list B whose documents should supplement the current list А and click OK.
The result of amalgamation of А + B will be shown on the screen. It will contain all documents available in at least one of the source lists.
Such amalgamation of the lists permits to obtain the sum of the two lists, which may help, for example, when compiling thematic collections.
There is a coupling operation where the result А + B is not shown on the screen but is saved in folders instead of list А. See page Add.

This command permits the system to open the folder window and suggest to choose an earlier saved list B to intersect it with the current list А. The result of intersection of А * B will contain documents common for both lists. In other words, the resulting list will include only those documents that were present in each of the source lists.
This command permits the system to open the folder window and suggest to choose an earlier saved list B whose documents should be excluded from the current list А.
The result of subtraction of А - B will contain the documents unique for the current list А. List А will be devoid of the documents present in list B.
To return to the source list А it used to be before the logical operation was carried out, use command Undo.

Any list may be filtered with one or several filters from the Filters. The filters, by definition, are the earlier saved search requests. When a filter is on, the system will fulfil this request as if applied to the current list and leave in it only those documents satisfying the request conditions. I.e. list filtering is a quick and convenient way to fulfil in it one or several refining searches and leave only the necessary documents.

Enabling the filters permits to leave in the opened list, for example, only the documents of a certain subject of the Federation, only the documents being in effect or the documents on a certain subject. Unnecessary documents will hidden with active filters in the course of your work with the list.

td.div: List filtered with active filters: "In effect" and "Other than individual". The list preserves only actual normative legal acts; the rest of the documents are hidden with these filters. A warning is displayed over the list.

topic.p: To enable a filter, invoke the filters tab with the Filters (panel) command from the upper menu and mark the necessary filters. They will be applied immediately to the current list.

A Warning List Filtered will appear over the list. Its purpose is to remind you that not all list documents are shown at the moment, but only the selection satisfying the conditions of the active filters.

You can set any filter for automatic use with the filter context menu switch. In this case, the filter will be applied automatically to all generated lists. As a result, all documents failing to meet the conditions specified in the filter applied automatically will be excluded from all lists.

The function is especially useful while working with large network sets including several blocks of regional legislation. In this case, if you work with documents of a particular region, it is enough to create a filter for the documents of the appropriate datablock and turn on its automatic use.

To revoke a filter, it is enough to remove the appropriate mark. There is also a command
permitting to revoke all active filters that are not permanent ones and return the list to the initial state.

The lists in GARANT System may be edited by copying list elements to the clipboard, inserting from the clipboard and deleting from the list. The editing may be useful, for example, when creating a thematic selection of documents for subsequent saving.

The copy and delete operations apply to selected list elements - one (current) or several. Several elements are selected as usually with the arrows / or mouse while holding depressed the keys Ctrl, Shift.

td.div: List editing. You can delete, copy and insert list elements, both one by one and selected groups. Document list shortcut menu is shown.

li.p: Command Delete removes one or several selected list elements. Evidently, this excludes the list from the given document without affecting in any way the system databank. In other words, the documents deleted from the list remain intact in the database.
Selected elements are copied to clipboard with the Copy command. Later, you can insert them in another list using the Paste command.
The fact of list editing is reflected on the tab Information. After any amendment to the list, there appears a Warning List Changed. The editing may be abandoned using the Undo command.

You can open selected documents as a separate list in a new GARANT System window using the Copy to new list command. To copy the whole of the current list in a new window, use the Open current list in new window command.

topic.p:
Command Save to My Documents... saves the list in folders located on the tab My Documents (panel). You can choose the folder to save the list. The system will remember the sorting procedure for the saved list, its history of creation and the current list element.
Later, you can invoke the saved list by simply clicking on it on the tab My Documents (panel).
The saved list may also be used for logical operations with two lists - the current and the saved ones.

Individual list documents may be saved in My Documents by simply dragging them with the mouse from the list to the folder you need on My Documents tab without invoking a special dialogue box. The document will be saved with its own name that can be changed later, if you wish, on the tab properties panel.
The work with folders when the list is saved is described on the page Saving in Folders.

Document lists may be saved in various ways. If you save the list in GARANT System folders, you can invoke it later for another use. Besides, the list may be saved on the hard disk in various formats, opened in MS Word, copied to clipboard or printed to printer.

li.p: Saving the list in folders is described on the page Saving in Folders.

ul.li:
Command Save to file... is used to save the list on the had disk. The saving dialogue permits to choose:
saving the whole list or only selected fragments;
saving document names from the list or their full texts. When you save the texts, you can also choose the saving method - single file or each document separately.
document format to save the list:
Extension Format Application
.txt
Text only
Notepad; any other word processor.
.rtf
RTF
MS Word; any other rtf editor.
.htm
HTML
Internet Explorer or any other web browser.
The saved list may be opened in any application supporting the chosen format.
Picture 55
List saving dialogue permitting to choose the object for saving.

li.p: To copy list elements to clipboard, select them using Select all and apply the Copy command. The elements copied this way are inserted in another list using the Paste command. Elements from clipboard may also be inserted in other applications, for example, a word processor. In this case, list elements will be inserted as an ordinary text.
Export to MS Word launches the rtf file editor installed on your computer and loads in it the current list in the appropriate format.
Printing the list to printer is fulfilled as usually using the Print command.

ul.li: The command will create a new message with an attached RTF file containing a full list of investigated documents or a list of selected elements.

topic.p: By default, list printing and exporting to MS Word is fulfilled without nesting and wordings, however, this can be changed using the setting Export and print lists without nesting.
GARANT System documents is a legally processed text of the source document supplied with exhaustive reference information.

td.div: GARANT System document.

topic.p: The full list of commands available for the document may be found on the guide page Document. The present section provides descriptions of the most interesting of these functions.
In the course of the legal processing, document texts are prepared in a special way:

ul.li: Documents with a complex internal structure are supplied with the contents;
division headings are marked with a special font;
Numerous hyperlinks to other system documents are inserted;
Comments are added to facilitate text investigation:

td.div: Document elements.
Document excerpts.

topic.p: More details on the mentioned elements may be found on the pages of the given subsection.
Document text usually consists of the document name, names of divisions and their content, as well as various comments. Both the main text and comments may include hyperlinks.
The default, the markings of the document text elements are as follows:

li.span: These are the names and headings.
This is the way GARANT System comment looks like.
This font is used to mark comments you may add to the documents text.

topic.p: If you use the Style Editor, you can change the fonts of all listed elements.
topic.h3: Menu of Operations with Document Section
topic.p: Against each document structural unit (section, chapter, article, item), there is a pictogram , on the left in the margin to open a drop-down menu with the following operations for the given section if you click on it:

tr.td: Highlights the text of the selected document section in the Main Window.
Opens in the Additional Window the list of documents of information type Judicial Practices containing links to the selected document section.
Opens in the Additional Window the list of documents of information type Comments containing links to the selected document section.
Opens in the Additional Window the list of documents containing links to the selected document section.
Inserts a bookmark in the beginning of the selected document section.
Launches MS Word and loads in it the text of the selected document section.
Fulfils immediately the printing of the selected document section.
Copies the text of the selected document section to clipboard.

topic.p: The methods of text selection, depending on the selection area are listed in the summary table.

tr.td: Place the cursor on the word beginning and, while holding depressed the keys Shift+Ctrl, press the right arrow key.
Place the mouse cursor on the word you need and double-click on it with the left mouse button.
Place the mouse cursor on the word you need and select in the shortcut menu command Select current window.
Place the cursor in the upper left or the lower right edge of the text block and, while holding depressed the key Shift, set the block borders with the arrows on the keyboard.
Place the mouse cursor in the upper left or lower right corner and, while holding depressed the left key, set the block borders by dragging the mouse cursor.
Place the mouse cursor on the paragraph you need and from the shortcut menu select command Select current paragraph.
Place the mouse cursor on any word in the paragraph you need and click three times on it with the left mouse button.
While holding depressed the key Ctrl, double-click on each of the words with the left mouse button.
While holding depressed the key Ctrl, select each block with the mouse using the principle described for the single text block.

Preset in the system settings permanent text selection. Select each block using the mouse or the keyboard arrows while holding depressed the key Shift. Removal of selection in this case is only possible through the shortcut menu command Unselect.
The whole of the document text
Move the cursor to the document text and press on the keyboard the key combination Ctrl+A.
In the shortcut menu of the document text, select command Select all.

topic.p: For convenience of navigation through the text with a single word accuracy, you can use commands Word left and Word right fulfilled by pressing of the key combinations Ctrl+Alt+ and Ctrl+Alt+.

To find the text fragment you need in the current document, use command Find context.... It invokes the Basic Search with the search area switch set to Given Document. This search applies to the whole visible document text including all types of comments if they are not disabled with special commands at the moment of search.

Hyperlinks and GARANT System comments are also included in the document text. Together with the main text, they are taken into account in the context search of the query card of Search by Details. User-added comments are not included in Search by Details.
The contents describes the hierarchy of chapters, items, articles and other document structural units.
It is placed on the tab Document Structure of the Navigation Panel and is shown automatically at document opening. To invoke the content tab, use the Document Structure command.

The contents highlight is synchronised with the visible position in the document text. Selection of contents element will switch you over to the appropriate place in the document text. And vice versa, text scrolling will affect the cursor position in the contents.
Contents elements may have links to both the document sections, being finished text fragments and to certain positions in the text, that do not have a clear ending.

td.div: Document contents and its sections.

topic.p: Document section is a text structural unit that has clearly defined beginning and end, as well as the name and number. As a rule, the name and number are assigned to the section by the issuing body and are present directly in the document text. Examples of sections are document chapters, articles and items:

ul.li: Chapter 7. Objects of Taxation
Section I. General Provisions
Article 7. Control over the Use of Cash Registers

topic.p: As in the case of the document text, the document contents may be printed using command , permit , print or may be exported to MS Word using command . The structure permits to apply , the use of which is taken into account in export, print and print preveiw features (i.e. if a context filter is applied to the structure, only the visible part of the contents (in accordance with the filter) will be exported or printed) .

For each of the contents element, there is a special submenu in the shortcut menu Contents Item having accumulated operations that apply to the text fragment corresponding to the given contents element. The list of commands with the description is provided in the table.

tr.td: Copies the text of the selected document section to clipboard.
Prints immediately the text of the selected document section.
Opens the text of the selected document section in the Print Preview Window.
Launches MS Word and loads in it the text of the selected document section.
Selects in the Main Window the text of the selected document section.
Opens in the Additional Window the list of Links from Selected Fragment.
Opens in the Additional Window the list of documents with links to the selected document section.
Inserts a bookmark in the beginning of the selected document section.

topic.p: The contents also shows the summary lists of bookmarks inserted in document, your added comments, as well as tables, images and embedded objects. These lists are shown as separate contents items.

For some documents, the contents is not shown. Usually, it is small documents without internal structure that do not contain sections, bookmarks, images, comments etc. - i.e. elements comprising the document contents.
A hyperlink is a specially marked text fragment that switches you over to the document legally connected with the current one when opened.

Thus, hyperlinks reflect explicit ( explicit links are those to the document clearly indicated in the current document text. )
and implicit ( implicit links are those to the documents that are not cited anywhere in the original context but legally related to it through the common norm of law. )
legal relations between documents. The number of hyperlinks in GARANT System documents is extremely big. Their total number for the current database may be found in the window Set Information.
When you place the mouse pointer on the hyperlink, the screentip shows the link type and the name of the respondent document it is connected to.

td.div: Hyperlinks in document text.

topic.p: GARANT System technology permits to make references not only to the beginning of the addressed document, but also a particular section within its text. There may be also local transfers within the current document.: for example, a hyperlink from the main text may refer to the document attachment placed in the end of the text. A hyperlink may include also several associated documents, not a single one. When you follow such link, a list of pertinent documents is loaded.

One type of hyperlinks is an Internet link. In contrast to the ordinary hyperlink, such link indicates a document in the Internet opened in the web browser when you follow it. The screentip for this type of links consists of a prefix Internet Link and the document Internet address.
Provided illustration shows all of the listed link types. Their appearance is the same, however, the context and screentips permit to understand which object is indicated in each link.

Special cursors are used to mark individual types of links. When you move the mouse to the link, the cursor will change, informing the user which object is on the "other end" of the link. The list of the types of links and the appropriate mouse cursor types are provided in the table:
Link type Cursor type
Link to an invalidated document
Link to a document not yet entered into force
Internet link
Link to a document absent in the user set

The system envisages opportunities of navigation through the links in the document text using the key combinations Alt+ (Previous Link) и Alt+ (Next Link). To follow the link under the cursor, use key combination Alt+Enter.

The lists Correspondents and Respondents play an important role in the study of relations between documents. They are shown on the tabs at the bottom of the document window and contain summary information for all hyperlinks associated with the current document.
The list Correspondents contains all documents with hyperlinks to the current document.
The list Respondents lists all documents addressed from the current document.
More details on the work with these lists may be found is on the page Correspondents/Respondents. Note the useful opportunity to build lists for individual text fragments.

Command Open current document in new window permits to load the addressed documents in a new GARANT System window rather than the current one. This is convenient, for example, when the respondent document is of interest, but you do not want to break the reading of the current document. Having opened the document of interest in a separate window, you can view it after you finish your work with the text of the current document.

Command Insert link... may be used to add own links from the texts of own comments. These links may contain a reference to any document, list or request earlier saved in folders My Documents (panel). Thus, you are free to connect any place in the document text with another document, list or search request. For more details, see page Adding Hyperlinks.

System documents contain numerous legal comments or GARANT System comments. These are remarks to the main document text where the links are provided to the amending or explaining documents, attention is attracted to differences in interpretation and misprints in the publication sources and controversies in the legislation.

Comments are placed by the company lawyers when processing the source document texts to facilitate for system users the study of documents and their interrelations. The total number of comments available in GARANT System documents can be easily found in the window Set Information.
Inserted comment is marked with a special font making it impossible to mix it with the original document text.

td.div: GARANT System and user comments.

topic.p:
Legal comments cannot be deleted or edited. However, you can hide them for the current document using command Show/Hide GARANT System comments. This switch affects also the presence of comments in the following operations:
Print
Save to file...
Export to MS Word
Comments will be printed or exported together with the text if they were enabled at the moment when the operation was invoked.
The text of GARANT System comments is included in the document search in the database, i.e. using the query card Search by Details.
You can add own comments in document texts. This issue is examined on the page Adding Comments.

Viewing document text in excerpts permits to hide those of its sections not pertinent to the subject of the preceding search. More detailed description of such documents may be found in section Opening in Excerpts.

The documents may be opened in excerpts directly from the list, as well as converted to the excerpts regime already while viewing using command Show/Hide excerpts. The same switch may return the document back to the full-text viewing regime.

The contents of the document opened in excerpts will also contain links to only selected fragments. To separate one excerpt from another, the excerpts regime uses a separating line for viewing. Besides, the system reminds when this regime is enabled with a floating Warning of document in excerpts.

td.div: Text in excerpts. Pertinent sections are separated from each other with horizontal lines.

topic.p: If you want to switch over to neighbouring excerpts in document, use commands:
They are available in either of the regimes - both the full-text and the excerpts regime.
GARANT System documents are supplied with detailed reference information:

ul.li: document information (document attributes)

topic.p: The next section of the reference system describes the lists Correspondents/Respondents of documents the current document is interconnected with.
All this information is displayed on the tabs in the document Additional Window .
The tab Document information contains the list of document properties including its individual search details, whereby the document may be found using the query card.

Tab visibility when you switch over to the document text is determined by the appropriate flag in section Document of the configuration settings. If the tab is "not visible", you can switch over to it using the key combination Alt+I.

td.div: Document information (document attributes).

topic.p: Let us list document attributes available on this tab in the commercial version of GARANT System. Nearly all of them are search details. For such attributes, there are links to descriptions of the appropriate fields of the query card:

ul.li:
Name.
(For search in the name, enter the search string in the query card in the field Words in the Name.)

sel.font: Date of connection to GARANT System

ul.li: Size of the document in bytes.

topic.p: The legal reference to the document is available on the tab Reference. Usually, it reports where and when the given document was published, provides the date of entry into force, its status, information on the state registration and lists the documents amending the given document.

td.div: Legal reference to the document.

topic.p: Legal warnings attract your attention to important aspects of practical application of the document. They are assigned to documents by Garant Company lawyers and usually contain information on the document status, its effective procedures, document state registration or its relations with the databank.
The text of the warning is provided on the tab Warning. In addition to it, there appears a special "floating" sign Warning (legal).

td.div: Types of warnings

topic.p: Examples of such warnings may include:

ul.li: Present document invalid!
Present document not yet entered into force!
Present international treaty not ratified by the Russian Federation!
Present document does not have power on the territory of the Russian Federation!
Present document suspended!
Present document looses force from January 1, 2005!
Present document is entered into force from January 1, 2005!
Present document is of normative nature and must be registered in the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation!
Present document is entered into force 90 days after its publication!
Normative act having adopted this document amended!
Document having inspired this comment lost force!
Present international treaty denounced by the Russian Federation!

From July 1, 2003 until the entry into force of the appropriate technical regulations, the state and interstate standards being in effect shall be applied on the voluntary basis, except for the obligatory requirements ensuring the goals of the legislation of the Russian Federation on technical regulation!

topic.p: Commands Correspondents and Respondents invoke the lists of documents with the same name providing full information on direct and indirect relations of the current document with other documents of the databank. The lists are shown on the tabs at the bottom of the document window and contain summary information on all hyperlinks associated with the current document.

td.div: List of correspondents - the documents the text or legal comments of which have a hyperlink to the current document.
List of correspondents - the documents the text or legal comments of which have a hyperlink to the current document.

topic.p: Separate tab permits to view lists of links to particular document sections or text fragments selected in advance, rather than the full document text. For more details, see page Lists of Correspondents and Respondents to Fragment.

When generating the lists of Correspondents/Respondents , you can also indicate the type of legal information of the documents of the list of interest to you. The size of the list will become significantly smaller.
The content of the lists of Correspondents/Respondents depends on the content of the databank. Documents that are not included in the current database are excluded from these lists automatically.

topic.h3: Lists of Respondents and Correspondents to Fragment
topic.p: Lists of Respondents and Correspondents are very important in the study of interdocument links. However, there are large documents describing various legal aspects and containing numerous hypertext links. For large documents, full lists of Correspondents/Respondents may be very big making hundreds and thousands of documents. Examples of such complex documents include the Constitution of the Russian Federation, many codes and some federal laws.

Therefore, GARANT System provides opportunities to show the lists of respondents and correspondents to a limited part of the document - text section or fragment. You often need only individual sections of the document - chapters, articles, paragraphs - regulating the issue of interest rather than the whole document. A means of analysis of links of only the part of the document with the rest of the mass of the legislation simplifies and speeds up your work with the normative base.

Commands
Correspondents to fragment and
Respondents to fragment
are represented by the tabs with the lists Correspondents to Selected Fragment/Respondents to Selected Fragment of the current document. They are invoked through the expanded menu of the toolbar buttons
and , as well as the shortcut menu of the selected text fragment. To apply these commands, there must be a selected fragment in the text.

td.div: List of respondents to fragment.

topic.p: Note that the lists to fragment are shown on a separate tab Respondents/Correspondents to Fragment. The list composition on this tabs may change depending on the size and position of the selected fragment. Besides, the tab is not present on the screen permanently, it appears only if you invoke the command to generate the list of respondents and correspondents to fragment.

If you use the functions described below, the tasks are solved in a quickest and most convenient way. In a number of cases, the solving of the problem by means of other search tools (for example, context search) is difficult or even impossible.

1. You need to investigate the issue of release from responsibility in case of an independent and timely correction by the taxpayer of mistakes in the submitted tax declaration. Opportunity to amend the tax declaration is envisaged in Article 81 of the Tax Code, with a number of particulars analysed in the letters of the Ministry of Taxation, author articles and questions and answers. The list of documents with references to the given article consists of 22 documents containing the searched information. Investigation of the mentioned materials will give you the answer to your questions.

2. The enterprise having suffered losses in the previous year investigates opportunities of exemption from the profit tax where it pertains to the resources allocated to cover the losses. The given exemption is envisaged in Item 5 of Article 6 of the Law of the Russian Federation on the profit tax from enterprises and organisations of December 27, 1991, however, the practice of its application and the procedure of determination of the amounts of the mentioned exemption are explained in detail in a series of other documents. When generating the list of documents with references to Item 5 of Article 6, the taxpayer gets a list of 25 documents where he finds the solution to his problem.

3. A citizen investigates the amount of compensation of the incurred moral damage. According to Article 151 of the Civil Code, the moral damage incurred on the citizen implies a compensation in the amount defined by the court. The list of documents with references to the mentioned Article consists of 30 documents. If you specify the type of legal information Judicial Practices, you will get the list of 9 documents reflecting the practices of courts on the issues of compensation of moral damage to citizens.

topic.h3: Specifying the Respondents and Correspondents List
topic.p: As we have emphasised already, the full lists Respondents/Correspondents may be big enough and, therefore, complicated for investigation. It is often known in advance what types of legal information are necessary: legal acts, document forms, court rulings etc. Such lists may be smaller in size and much more convenient for investigation.

Therefore, commands of generation of lists of respondents and correspondents permit to select the type of documents of interest for you. Appropriate toolbar buttons ( and ) are extended to include a drop-down menu listing the types of legal information. Use the down arrow on the right of the button to invoke the menu.

td.div: Specification of the type of lists of Respondents/Correspondents through the extended menu of toolbar buttons.

topic.p: By selecting the necessary type, you will get the list of documents of only this type (in the illustration: document forms). If you press the button directly, you will get a full, without specification, list of documents of all types.
You can filter the documents by the types of information also after building the list. To do it, use selection list Choose type.

For obtaining quickly a certain type of the list of Respondents/Correspondents , the system envisages special adjustable tabs User Respondents/Correspondents 1 and User Respondents/Correspondents 2 where you can switch over using commands User Correspondents/Respondents 1 and User Correspondents/Respondents 2 respectively. Each tab contains a list of the type specified in the settings .

Tracking the changes in the legislation is a most important aspect of work with the legal reference system. Thus, the New Documents subsection of the Reference Information section of the main menu of GARANT System contains all documents of the database that were changed recently. However, a regular viewing of the full lists of amended documents may require much time.

Therefore, GARANT System envisages the function of automatic tracking of your selected documents. When you flag the document of interest for you, the system will track independently the changes in its text and being in force status.
If certain events occur, the system will generate a notification and suggest viewing the list of amended flagged documents.

td.div: Key documents in your work may be flagged. The system will report the changes introduced in these documents.

topic.p: Any document of GARANT System may be flagged regardless of the type of legal information, datablock or the norms of law available in the document.

On June 10, 2004, the State Duma adopted in the first reading a number of draft laws on the market of affordable housing. 27 documents formed the packet of documents, including the new Housing Code of the Russian Federation.
The list of these draft laws is available in the Excerpt from Protocol 24 of the Session of the Council of the State Duma of May 11, 2004. It is included in the datablock Draft Laws.

The flagging of the antecedents of these draft laws will permit you to get operatively information on the passing by these draft laws of all stages in the State Duma, Council of the Federation and the President of the Russian Federation.

You can flag an unlimited number of documents. To flag the document,
open its text and click the switch on the toolbar Flag document. The button will depressed. This means that the document is "flagged".
If you want to flag the document saved in folders, check option Flagged in the document saving dialogue box.

td.div: Flagging the document saved in folders.

topic.p: The document already saved in folders may be flagged by checking the mark Flagged document in the shortcut menu.
Deleting the document from folders does not affect its flagged status.
If you want to flag several documents from the list, select them with your mouse and the keys Shift or Ctrl and then choose from the shortcut menu command Flag selected documents.
The list of all flagged documents may be found on the panel Flagged documents. To invoke it, use the toolbar button .

td.div: List of flagged documents. Documents with amendments are marked with a special sign.

topic.p: Removal of the document from this tab (Delete) will unflag the document.

Each time the system is started, it finds out if the databank was updated. If it was, all flagged documents are checked automatically for amendments. If at least one document is changed, the system will display a notification in the form of a special animated warning where the cursor, when placed on it, assumes the same form as in the case of a hyperlink:

td.div: System warning appearing at GARANT System start up. It reports that some flagged documents changed since the last system entry.

topic.p: The list of amended documents may be found on the tab Flagged Documents invoked from the toolbar using command Flagged Documents. This tab is described below on the current page.

It may happen that you cannot view all amendments in the given session and end you work before viewing the texts of all changed documents. In this case, all unviewed documents with amendments will still be marked as such. When you enter the system next time, you will see the appropriate notification of changes available in the flagged documents. See also page Resetting the Markings.
This tab contains the list of documents you flagged. Documents with amendments are marked with a special sign.

td.div: List of flagged documents. Documents with amendments are marked with a sign, the screentip showing the type of change. (Place the mouse cursor on the document to see the screentip.)

topic.p: By default, the list of documents on the tab is sorted by the "changed" status. This means that all documents with amendments are grouped in the beginning of the list.

Within this group, the documents are sorted in addition by the status of introduced amendments. First, the acts that entered into force are listed. Then, the documents with amendments. The group is closed by the documents that lost force. You can change the sorting procedure by adjusting the documents, for example, by the alphabet by using the Sort command.

If you use the List of Changes in Flagged Documents command, you can generate the list of all changed documents in the system Main Window. You can work with it the same way as with an ordinary list of documents of GARANT System.
When you open a flagged document "with amendments", you will see a warning Warning (Flagged Document). It will report to you the changes that occurred in this document.

td.div: When you open a flagged document, the system will show a "floating" warning.

topic.p: The flagged document is considered to have been amended in the following cases:

tr.td:
Document is adopted in a new wording and its official text has changed.
Note. Additions in the texts of GARANT System comments are not considered to be amendments, since they are not a part of the official document. Amendments do not include also: а) bringing the document text in compliance with the official publication and b) amendments placed in the sources of official publication.

Document having acquired the
efficiency status of "being in effect".

Document having acquired the
efficiency status of "having lost force".

sel.font: Document registered in the Ministry of Justice

tr.td: Document having acquired the status of state registration "registered".
Document having been denied the state registration.

topic.p: System settings permit you to indicate the moment when you want to reset the "changed status ( If this sign is active with the document, it is marked with a special icon in the list, and there appears a notification of the presence of documents with amendments at system entry. ) " with the flagged document. You can reset the "changed" status manually or automatically.

li.p: The manual setting implies that the system resets the "changed" status with command Reset "changed" status. With this setting, the document that was changed once is considered to be as such until you order the system that the given document is no longer considered to be changed.
In the case of automatic setting, the document is no longer considered to be changed after you open its text for viewing.

There exist both an immediate resetting of the "changed" status (the changes are considered adopted immediately after document opening) and a delayed one (the mark of changes will be removed at the moment of exit from GARANT System).

topic.p: You can add your own remarks of free content to the texts of GARANT System documents. Such remarks are called user comments. Your added comments may be hidden or shown again, edited or removed from the document any moment of time.

Such comments are marked with special signs on the document margin and colour which is different from the main text and GARANT System comments . There is no danger to damage the original text, since the document itself stored in the database is not changed when comments are added. User text is always added between the paragraphs of the analysed text.

Comments may be added to any text paragraph. Place the cursor on the analysed paragraph (or a line after the paragraph) and invoke the command Add my comment. You can also use the key Enter. The system will create an empty paragraph suitable for editing.

Enter the text of the comment. You can interrupt the entry of the comment any moment and continue it later. There is no need to take any actions to save the entered comment. All changes are saved automatically when the text is entered.
Apart from the entry of the text of the comment, GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT envisages additional opportunities of editing of the comment, such as: text formatting and adding tables.

td.div: GARANT System and user comments.

topic.p: To change the comment, place the cursor where you need in the text of the comment and edit the text the same way as in an ordinary word processor.
To remove the comment, use command Delete comment. You can also delete the whole of the comment text. When you quit the document, the system will remove the empty comment automatically.
You can get the list of all documents where you added your comments if you follow the bookmark Documents with Comments of My Comments folder of the tab My Documents.
You can make all comments invisible by using the Show/Hide my comments command.

The work with comments is similar to the work in an ordinary word processor, however, with a restriction: the system will not permit to damage the initial document text. Comments may only be added between the paragraphs of the original text.
Let us list some particulars of work with comments.

li.p:
In operations of:
Print
Save to file...
Export to MS Word
the show of comments depends on the condition of the switch Show/Hide my comments. The comments will be printed or exported together with the text if the show of comments is on at the moment when the operation is invoked.

The text of the comment you entered may be found using the context search in the current document. In other words, user comments are taken into account when carrying out the Find context... operation. It is evident that the show of comments must be turned on, since the hidden text is not included in search operations.
If the document has several wordings, comments are saved in the one where they were added in the document text. In other wordings, they will not be seen.
Comments of each user are personal in the multiple user version of GARANT System, i.e. hidden from other system users.
Links to comments are added automatically to the document contents.
The system does not permit to enter two spaces in a row in the comments and a space at the line beginning. The system does not save empty comments, i.e. the ones that do not contain any text.
Note that the Enter key permits to add comments only if the user comments show regime is turned on.

topic.p:
GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT provides the following features to edit user comments:
text formatting
inserting and editing tables

You can format any fragment of text of your comment. To do it, you have to select the necessary fragment and choose the necessary formatting type (command) from the shortcut menu. If the fragment is not selected, the formatting will apply to the word under the cursor or the text on the left of the cursor.
The types of formatting are provided in the summary table.
The types of formatting may be mixed in any combination.
The buttons of the types of formatting may be added to the document toolbar by setting up this toolbar.

In addition to the ordinary text, your comment may contain a table (with equal number of cells in each line or column) . This may be done using the command from the shortcut menu Insert table. The line height in the table is fixed, and the column width may be adjusted independently by placing the pointer on the column border to move.
When the pointer assumes the form , press the left mouse button and, while holding it depressed, change the column width by dragging its border with the cursor and release the mouse where necessary.

By default, a 3x3 table is created, however, the number of lines and columns may be changed using the commands available in the comment shortcut menu. The list of commands is provided in the summary table.

tr.td: Inserts a row in the table at the top of the current one.
Inserts a column in the table on the left of the current one.

topic.p: Commands of modification of the size of the table may be added to the document toolbar by setting up this toolbar.
If you want to insert in the comment the tables of intricate structure (for example, with cells joined together) , they should be edited in MS Word and copied from there through the clipboard.

You can add independently in your comments to system documents hypertext links to other documents (as well as the sets of documents and search requests). Addition of such links to ordinary text will notably improve user comments comprehension and convenience.

If you need to make a reference to any document, save it in advance in folders My Documents (panel). Now, to insert a hyperlink in it, select in the other document the comment fragment to be formatted as a link. Invoke command Insert link.... (For convenience, use the shortcut menu invoked with the right mouse button).

td.div: Adding a hyperlink to the user comment. Select the text fragment you need and invoke the shortcut menu. (Fragment selection is not obligatory, in which case the hyperlink will be placed on the word from comment nearest to the cursor.)

topic.p: The hyperlink addition command will display the window My documents (panel). Select in this window the document, list or search request to be indicated in the created hyperlink to. Creation of the hyperlink is over.

td.div: Select the object to be indicated in the hyperlink. Such object may include any document, list or request saved in folders.

topic.p: Besides, your comments may be used to insert existing links from any Platform F1 document. To do it, it is enough to select the text of the link, copy it to the clipboard using the key combination Ctrl+C and then paste it using the key combination Ctrl+V where you need it in your comment.

Later, such link may be opened as usually. The documents and lists you specified will simply load in the current window. And when opening the request, the system will fulfil this request automatically and generate the list of documents.
If you use command Change link... you can change any moment the object indicated in the link. Link "editing" is accomplished the same way as its adding.
To remove the hyperlink, use command Delete link. In this case, only the markings used to format the hyperlink are removed, with the text of the comment being left intact.

If you use command Save to My Documents..., the document may be saved in folders My Documents (panel) where it can be invoked from with the double click of the mouse. Thus, you can create sets of links necessary in your work.
