One more useful function is envisaged to save the documents. When you work with documents, you can insert bookmarks in the text as if reading an ordinary book. The bookmarks permit not only to save the document, but also remember the position in the document text with one paragraph accuracy. When you use the bookmark, the system will load the document exactly where the bookmark is inserted.

Move the pointer to the paragraph where you need to insert the bookmark (this paragraph is called the current one). After using the Insert bookmark command, the system will display a window of folders and suggest to enter the name of the saved bookmark. If you wish, you may supply the inserted bookmark with an explanatory comment. By default, the system will suggest the name and comment reflecting the document name and the position where the bookmark is inserted.

td.div: Inserting a bookmark in the document text.

topic.p: When you insert the bookmark, there appears the sign Bookmark (icon) opposite the paragraph. A link to the bookmark will be shown in the document contents.
You can choose an inserted bookmark any moment of time on the tab My Documents (panel) and immediately open the necessary document. The system will load its text and place the cursor on the bookmark.

td.div: Choosing the bookmark.

topic.p: If the document is already opened, you can use the tab Document Structure to navigate through the bookmarks. Section Bookmarks contains a full list of bookmarks in the text of the current document.

If you want to navigate through the bookmarks, you can use also command Go to bookmark. It permits to switch over consecutively from one bookmark to another, as well as to choose a free bookmark for the drop-down list. This is a "one-touch" move.

td.div: Navigation through bookmarks in the document text.

topic.p: To edit the bookmark properties, use command Change bookmark name and comment. This command displays the tab My Documents (panel) in the properties editing mode. You can change the name and comment of the given bookmark.

td.div: Bookmark editing.

topic.p: To delete the bookmark from the text, use the shortcut menu of the sign Bookmark (icon) and invoke command Delete comment. The system will generate a refining question, after which the bookmark is deleted.

li.p: Bookmarks may be used not only in documents, but also in references to documents.

The folders do not save the document text, but a link to the document and paragraph number. This means that after the document update, the bookmark will still indicate the most recent, actual document version.

topic.p: GARANT System documents may be saved in various ways. If you save the document in GARANT System folders, you can open it later for subsequent use. Besides, the document may be saved on the hard disk in various formats, opened in MS Word, copied to clipboard or printed to printer.

li.p: Saving the document in folders is accomplished by using the Save to My Documents....

After inserting a bookmark, the document may also be saved in folders, with the system not only saving the bookmark in the document beginning, but also remembering its position in the text where the bookmark was inserted.
Command Save to file... is used to record the document in file on the hard disk. Several formats are envisaged to save the document.

tr.td: Internet Explorer or any other web browser.

li.p: The saved document may be later opened in any application supporting the chosen format.

To copy the selected fragment of the text to clipboard, use command Copy. The fragment from clipboard may be later inserted, for example, in MS Word. Text formatting (colours, underlining etc.) in this case will be saved.
Command Export to MS Word launches the rtf file editor installed on your computer (usually, MS Word) and loads the current document in it preserving the formatting.

The printing of the document to printer is fulfilled as usually - using the Print... command. The system will show the Print dialogue box where you can specify various print parameters. Preliminary viewing of the printing results is available through the Print Preview command.

When printing the tables that do not fit in the standard sheet width, the system will automatically reduce the table font and change the page orientation (portrait or landscape). In most cases, this permits to adapt the width of a large table to the sheet size and produce a printout more convenient for work and reading.

ul.li: The command will create a message with an attached RTF file containing the text of the investigated document or selected text fragment.

topic.p: In prolonged operations , you can see a progress indicator (varicoloured stripe) informing that the process is underway. When you save the document to file or export it to MS Word, the progress indicator is shown as a separate element, and in case of a print preview, the same indicator is shown in the status bar of the Main Window.
The folders My Documents (panel) is a storage of your bookmarks, lists and search requests.
While working with the system, you can save any of the listed objects to return to it later.

A tree ( The tree (hierarchy) structure is formed by folders enclosed in each other. )
structure of the folders permits to arrange the storage of information as convenient. You can manage the folder structure creating or removing enclosed folders the way you manage the folders on the hard disk.
The objects saved in My Documents folder are automatically sorted by type (Folders\Requests\Lists\Bookmarks), with objects of the same type - additionally by alphabet.
The tab My Documents (panel) is present on the Navigation Panel by default. If it appears to be hidden, it may be shown again with the button My Documents.

td.div: Folders (general view).

topic.p: The saving of documents, lists and search requests is accomplished in a similar way. The saving requires that while in a document, list or a query card, you invoke the Save to My Documents... command.
In the case of a document, you can also insert bookmarks. If you use it, you can save the document while remembering the position in the document text.

When you invoke the save command, the system will show the window My Documents (Save as...).
Select ( To select the folder, a) click on it with you mouse once or b) move the highlight to it with the arrows keys. )
the folder to save the object.

While saving, you can create an additional enclosed folder using the command Create folder. It will be created in the folder that was highlighted when the command was invoked. Inside the new folder, another enclosed folder may be created - the number of levels is not restricted.
More detailed description of the work with folders is available on the page Managing Folders.
If necessary, change the name of the saved object and add a comment to it. Click OK. The saving is over.

td.div: You can change the object name and comment to it when saving it to folders.

topic.p:
Besides a simple saving to folder, the system envisages additional saving functions:
If you place the cursor over the saved object and press OK, the system will request confirmation of the replacement of the earlier saved object with the new one. Overwriting is permitted for the objects of the same type only, thus, for example a request may be written over the request, and the list, over the list etc.
When you save the list, you can supplement the earlier saved list with documents of the new, saved list. This action is preformed with the Add button.

You can change the object name and comment already after saving the object in folders. If you use the Properties command, the system will show the Properties panel where you can enter necessary corrections and save them using the OK button.

To retrieve the saved object, switch over to the My Documents (panel), unwrap the necessary folder and open the saved object by double-clicking on it with your mouse. The document or list will be loaded in the system Main Window.
Below on this page, object retrieving from folders is described in more detail.

td.div: To retrieve the saved document, list or request from folders, double-click on it with your mouse.

topic.p:
If the tab My Documents (panel) is hidden, it may be returned to the screen with the toolbar button
or the identical command My Documents from the system Main Menu.

If you do not want to open each folder separately, use command Expand all. To speed up the finding of the necessary object in folders, there is a tool called Filtering folder elements by type. If you use it, you can quickly choose the objects of only one type among the saved documents, lists and requests. For example, you can leave only search requests visible.
To open a saved object, it is enough to double-click on it with your mouse or invoke from the shortcut menu command Open. A similar action is performed by command Open in new window.
When you open folder elements, the system will fulfil the following actions depending on their type:

Document, bookmark in document. Loads the document and switches over to the text beginning (or the bookmark position). More detailed description of the work with bookmarks is provided on the page Bookmarks.
Document list. Loads the list.

Request. A request may be opened using two methods - with or without execution.
In the case of ordinary opening of the search request, the system will automatically execute the request and show the resulting document list.
If you want to load the query card with details instead of the list, use command Open query card. (You can invoke it, for example, from the request shortcut menu.) In this case, you can view and edit the request before processing it.

GARANT System folders are like those on the hard disk of your computer. You can create, delete and rename the folders. This permits to form the structure of the saved records to find them easily later. For example, you can create a separate folder to store document forms, and use another one for normative acts temporarily needed for a particular issue etc.

td.div: GARANT System folders are enclosed one into the other forming a hierarchy list. You can create new folders, rename, relocate or delete them.

li.p:
The new folder is created with Create folder command. To do it, place the pointer on the folder where the new folder must be enclosed in. Press the button
and, on the properties panel, enter the name of the new folder. Press OK.
The number of enclosed folders is free. In other words, you can create a new folder in the one created by you, and so on.

To move any folder element ( Such element may include a folder and an objects saved in folder - document, list or request. )
from one folder to another, use the drag-and-drop operation (drag-and-drop). "Grab" the moved element with your mouse and drag it to the folder you need the way you do it to the folders and files on the hard disk of your computer.
To rename the folder, initiate command Properties. The properties panel will appear where you can change the name and comment to the given folder.
To delete the folder, place the pointer on it and initiate command Delete. You can also use the Del key.
To view the whole of the folder structure, it is convenient to use command Expand all. This command unwraps all enclosed folders.

You can facilitate the finding of the necessary folder element by using the filter Filtering folder elements by type. It permits to quickly hide any folder elements other than the pertinent type. For example, you can choose the viewing regime "lists only" or "requests only". Other types of saved objects will not be seen in this regime.

topic.p: Platform F1 EXPERT has a flexible system of settings permitting to improve the comfort of your work with the program as much as possible. It includes:

ul.li: Configuration settings.
Toolbar settings.
Page settings.
Style editing.

topic.p: Configuration is a designated multitude of interface and functional settings. GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT has two preset configurations: the Main and the Extended one. The settings of any of them may be changed in addition in each user profile. Besides, each system user can create own configurations by copying existing ones and editing them afterwards.
You can switch over to the editing of configuration settings from the panel Configuration using the Edit command from the Configuration context menu of the selected configuration.

td.div: Switching over to the editing of selected configuration.

topic.p:
Configuration settings are subdivided into eight thematic sections:
Configuration
Interface settings
System behaviour
Search
Document lists
Document
My documents
Flagged documents
Context filtering
For the Administrator Interface, there is a special section Administrator where the access is permitted to the system administrator only.

The default settings of preset configurations are implied to be initial settings specified in the system before the first launch, and for configurations created by the user, the current settings for the preset configuration that was copied to produce the user configuration. The changed user configuration settings may be used as default ones if you apply the Save as default command.
You can return the changed settings to the default condition if you use the Restore command. To return to the initial condition not only the configuration settings but also other system settings, use command Restore all.
This page provides the list and description of the settings of the Configuration section:

td.div: Configuration settings. Configuration section.

topic.p: Most of the windows of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT have own adjustable toolbars. You can switch over to the settings of the panel of interest to you by using command Settings of the shortcut menu of the given panel.

td.div: Switching over to the settings of the chosen toolbar.

topic.p:
The toolbar settings may be divided into:
common and
personal
The common settings specify the appearance of the buttons of all toolbars and are found on the tab Additional Settings. They include:

td.hint: Group of switches (Permits to choose only one value from the group.)

tr.td: The given parameter permits to select the size (Small Medium Large) of the command buttons on toolbars or to turn on the intellectual mechanism of determination of the optimal size of buttons depending on the monitor resolution using the Auto option.

td.hint: Group of switches (Permits to choose only one value from the group.)

tr.td: The given parameter specifies the number of colours of the button image.

topic.p: The given group of settings depends on the parameter of the system object of the type Drop-Down List (Select one of the listed values) . It includes:

ul.li: setting up the composition of commands available on the panel
setting up the hot key combinations for commands of the chosen panel

topic.h3: Setting up the Composition of Commands
topic.p: The setting up of the composition and the location procedure for the current panel commands are fulfilled on the tab Toolbars.

td.div: Setting up the composition of the chosen toolbar.

topic.p: The composition of operations available on each panel if fixed. You can find the panel composition in section Panel of the page of description of the window of interest for you, section windows of the given guide. The composition of commands available on the panel is listed in the window Current Operations and may be supplemented with commands from the window Available Operations. To remove a command from the panel, it should be relocated from the Current Operations into the Available Operations. Commands are moved between windows by dragging with the mouse or by using commands and .

The sequence of commands in the window Current Operations determines the procedure of their location on the toolbar. The higher the command position in the window, the closer it is to the left panel border. You can position the chosen command by using the buttons and .

Each command of the window Current Operations has also the setting Show of the type Group of Switches (Permits to choose only one value from the group.) which determines whether the name of the operation should be displayed on the panel.
The choice of hot key combinations to invoke the commands from the keyboard is available on the tab Keyboard Shortcuts.

td.div: Setting up the composition of the chosen toolbar.

topic.p: The hot key combination is assigned to the command as follows:

ul.li: place the cursor in the entry field Keyboard Shortcuts;
select the desire combination on the keyboard;

if the background of the combination text is red, the given combination is already reserved for another command of the given window, and you should select another combination - press the button Clear and return to the second step;
if the background is white, press the button Add to assign the selected combination, after which the chosen combination will be added to the Keyboard Shortcuts list.

topic.p: You can delete the assigned combination by selecting it in the Keyboard Shortcuts list and pressing Delete.

When you switch over to the window of settings of control panels, GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT automatically saves the current status of toolbars. If you made several changes and want to revoke them while going on with the set-up, use command Cancel. If you want to enable the changes without quitting the toolbar set-up regime, you should use command Apply. And, finally, if you want to return the default settings of all toolbars and key combinations, use command Restore all

For the purposes of printing, GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT envisages opportunities of setting up the page which include:
margins
paper size (paper format/page orientation)
running heads

The page settings are divided thematically into four tabs. Each tab consists of the area of parameters to edit the settings and the preview area (common for all tabs) to display the document view with the specified parameters.

The default page settings are implied to be the initial settings specified in the system before the first launch. The changed settings may be set as default using command Save as default. You can reverse the changed settings to default values by using command Restore.

The margins is a distance from the text to the page edge. The total size of the margins regulating one of the page dimensions may not be greater than the regulated paper size. If the entered margin value is too big, it will be changed automatically.

GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT distinguishes running heads of the first page (the settings of the "first page") and the rest of the document pages (the "page" tab). Editing opportunities for both tabs are identical.
You can choose the running head for editing from the drop-down list (Select one of the listed values.) of the Running Head parameter or by clicking with your mouse on the necessary running head.

td.div: Page settings. Editing running heads.

topic.p: Selected running head is edited in the text field. When entering the text, you can use special expressions (character combinations) that are replaced in the course of printing with the number of the printed page, current date, time etc. The table below provides a full list of expressions.

tr.td: Application name (GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT)
Ordinal number of the current page from the document beginning taking into account the current font settings
Total number of pages in the document taking into account the font settings
Current date as of the moment of printing
Current time as of the moment of printing

topic.p: Column Macro Command shows the text area shortcut menu command entering the appropriate expression in the current cursor position.

For convenience of visual perception, document texts in GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT are marked as follows. Each text element has a certain style of markings. Style editor is a tool permitting the user to set up the document text markings independently.

td.div: Style editor.

topic.p:
The markings style is a set of font parameters, such as:
Font type
Font colour
Background colour
Size (points)
Typeface (italics, bold)
Effects (underline, strikethrough). Parameter values may be changed in the window Font Parameters for Style:, with the result of the changes being automatically shown in the window Style Editor Text Window.

The styles are connected to each other by the principle of inheritance. The list of all styles is present as a tree structure in the window Style Tree. Such presentation permits to illustrate vividly the hereditary links of styles. Thus, an "enclosed style" derives some of its parameters from the "above (parent) style". The type of inheritance is determined individually for each parameter by the switch button assuming the following values:

tr.td: Parameter value must be indicated explicitly to define the style of depiction of the text element.
Parameter value is derived from the parent style. For example, the default font size of the Article Heading is determined by the size of the parent style Normal.

Parameter value is derived from the context element. For example, if there is a hyperlink in the text of the comment, the lettering slope of such link by default will be determined by the lettering slope of the style Comment.

topic.p: There is an opportunity to restore the initial settings used in the system by default. This action is preformed with command Restore.
Administrator interface is a mechanism of management of users (user profiles) of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT. The section contains its description.

The notion of "management" includes the following features:
Creation of a new user (profile)
Deleting a user (profile)
Editing of user profile parameters
User disconnection from the system
Managing access to paid advice
Managing user self-registration in the system
Some of the listed operations are accompanied by informative or warning messages which may be disabled in the Administrator section of the Configuration Settings.

Access to the Administrator Interface is permitted only from the GARANT System administrator account (ADMIN\ADMIN by default, case sensitive) which opens the interface window immediately after the system entry. You can return to the interface by using command List of Users and Groups of the toolbar of the program Main Window.
The administrator profile also permits to launch service utilities for the work with GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT databank, such as the Data Installation Wizard, Packet Update Wizard etc.

It is positively recommended to save the new value in a safe place in the case of change of the administrator account password to avoid the loss of access to the existing base of user settings and installation/update utilities.

If the administrator password is changed, you will have to undergo the authorisation procedure to launch the databank installation/update utilities. See description of utilities in the Databank Installation and Update Guide

GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT users may be classified using two parameters - profile types and status in the system.
The profile type (type, for short) divides the users into the ordinary and system ones. System users are those necessary for the system needs (for example, the Administrator).
The status in the system divides the users into active ones, i.e. working with the system at the present moment and the disconnected one.

The administration interface consists of the Main and the Additional Windows, as well as the User Management Toolbar. The Main Window contains the list of users and groups, and the Additional - the properties of the user selected in the Main Window.

td.div: Administrator interface window

topic.p: The list of users and groups presented in the form of a tree is the main part of the interface. Its view permits to assess the quantity, type and status of users available in GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT. The types of the list elements and their description are provided in the table.

tr.td: User working with GARANT System at the moment
User disconnected from GARANT System at the given moment
User with the "system" status working with GARANT System at the moment
User with the "system" status disconnected from GARANT System at the given moment

topic.p: If you use command User Filter, you can filter the list by the user type or status. You can apply a Context Filter to the list that will filter simultaneously user and registration names.
This page describes user management operations
Creation of a new user in the Administrator Interface is fulfilled with command Create new user and includes the filling of the user properties form according to the Rules of Registration.
If the form fields are filled in correctly, the button Save becomes visible, the pressing of which creates a new user profile that appears in the list.

To edit the existing user parameters, select him in the list. In the Additional Window you will see the properties of the selected user. Edit the values in accordance with the Rules of Registration in the system. Save the changes with the button Save.
The user registration name (login) selected at initial registration may not be edited.

To delete an existing user, select him in the list and press the button Delete user on the toolbar. You can delete the profile only if the user is not active. If the user is active, he must be disconnected before deleting the profile.
topic.h3: Disconnecting a User from the System
topic.p: To disconnect the working user from the system, select him in the list and disconnect using the Disconnect user command. The user will get a timer warning of his discontinuation within 30 seconds and may save the results of work. Upon expiry of the mentioned time, he will be discontinued automatically.
The Administrator Interface will stop showing the user active only after the timer warning is closed on the client machine.

Operations of user discontinuation and removal may be applied to a group of users simultaneously. To do it, it is necessary to select in the Administrator Interface the users you plan to discontinue from the system and whose accounts you plan to remove, after which the appropriate function must be applied. In the case of a packet removal or discontinuation, the system will show a warning and suggest to confirm the operation.

If you use command Allow/Deny new user self-registration, you can manage user self-registration in the system. When the self-registration prohibition is enabled, the Administrator will be suggested to enter contact information to be displayed to users attempting the New User link of the window GARANT System Entry.

The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.

The Administrator Interface of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT envisages opportunities of managing the access to the paid advice both for all users simultaneously and for each user personally. The joint use of these settings permits to quickly and efficiently share the rights of access to the paid advice.

topic.p: This section of the guide describes GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT tools permitting to work more efficiently with the databank.

The Context Filter is used in various sizable element lists (navigator sections, descriptions of situations,
contents, user list ) for a temporary disabling of unnecessary list elements. The filter permits to hide quickly all list elements where the names do not contain the specified text string.

Enter in the context filter field the text string to be found in the searched list elements. It is not necessary that the searched name should begin with the specified string. It may be present also in the middle of the name, in the middle of any word of the name. The given setting is determined by the parameter Context Position of the group of configuration settings Context Filtering.

You can enter several words - to select the elements satisfying all specified conditions. You can specify the word order significance using parameter Word Order of the group of configuration settings Context Filtering, and for the multilevel lists (Legal Navigator, Search by Keywords, and Search by Source of Publication) , you can use parameter Search Area of the group of configuration settings Context Filtering to specify the area where all searched words must be found.

In case of an error at entry, a system sound is played as soon as the entered sequence of characters no longer meets all available details, and the entered values are painted red disabling subsequent entry of characters.
With the filter enabled, all unmatching elements will be invisible, thus permitting to find easily the necessary element among the rest.

td.div: Context filter in descriptions of situations.

topic.p: With the filter enabled, the context string editing is taken into account by the system automatically. As soon as you enter or delete a character, the list is filtered anew.
In the course of the filtering, the hierarchy structure of the list is preserved. It preserves not only the "found" elements matching the name, but also the superjacent folders of the found elements.

td.div: The filtered list preserves the elements laying over the found ones. In the case of the Legal Navigator, the lists of the found folder are also shown.

topic.p:
Sometimes, you need to refine the search results after a successful processing of the request. For example, this may be the case if
obtained list appears to be too big, and it makes sense to include additional search details to restrict the search area
you have obtained the list as a result of the Search by Keywords and now you want to make the results more particular using the search details known to you. You can fulfil an additional search in the obtained list by using command Refine list

Moreover, you can refine any active list (list opened in the program Main Window at the current moment)
with this command regardless of the method of its obtaining. Thus, for example, the list may be obtained from the legal navigator or as list of Correspondents/Respondents.

annotation.p: The Guide contains a description of interface elements of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT: windows, commands available in them, menu items and toolbar buttons. The Guide pages are invoked as an operative aid when F1 button is pressed.
The Guide is not intended for end-to-end reading. It is recommended to address it to get help when you have problems working with particular system components.

topic.p: The program interface consists of a set of windows (document or list window, navigation panel tab, search form etc.). These windows contain interface elements (text, images, hyperlinks, folders ... ) where commands apply. The present Guide contains descriptions of all windows with a list of available commands for each of them.
The most important commands are available in , envisaged for some of them .
Descriptions contain also text comments and illustrations.

annotation.p: Appendices contain information for experienced system users and the Technical Support Team, provide developer advice that may help to organise your work with the system on a professional level, describe the frequently asked questions.

topic.p: Appendices contain information for experienced system users and the Technical Support Team, provide developer advice that may help to organise your work with the system on a professional level, describe the frequently asked questions.

Illustrations forming part of the Guide. The sequence of illustrations is preserved, i.e. corresponds to the procedure as they appear in the text of the Guide. An exception is the ones in the section Guide, which are placed in the end of the list.
Illustrations are supplied with signatures, as well as the links to the parent pages.

GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT has a client server architecture implying a separation into two program parts: the server and the client one. This page explains briefly the terms "client" and "server", as well as describes technical differences between the local and the network options of GARANT System.
The given text is intended for the employees providing technical maintenance of the system. Nevertheless, the content is described as simply as possible, which does not require any special knowledge.

The server is a special program working on a designated powerful computer. The term "server" is used for both the name of the program and the name of this computer. It is usually clear from the context which type of server - the software or the hardware - is implied.

The client (client part) is the user application launched on the work stations, i.e. user personal computers. The client part is actually the face of the system. It is the client part that is usually associated with the user with any client server application. Thus, GARANT System shell is the client part of the composite system.
The file server is a designated computer used to store information (as a rule of large volume) where the access to read it is provided to other machines of the local network.

In the course of work, program shells launched by users on their computers apply for data to the system server. The server retrieves the documents from the database, processes them appropriately and hands over to the program shell where the data is displayed in the user interface. Many resource-consuming operations, such as the document search, are also fulfilled on the server.

td.div: Client server architecture

topic.p: Such separation pursues several goals. We shall emphasise two of them. The first: the system server fulfils the hardest part of the work, thus permitting to reduce the load on the user personal computers. Hence, technical requirements to the work stations are reduced significantly. The second advantage of the client server architecture that we wish to emphasise here is a significant reduction of the network traffic. The point is that the transfer of the request from the shell to the server and getting the reply create a lower load on the local network as compared to the case when each user shell communicates independently with the system databank.

It is evident that the functional differences of the server and client parts are found in the technical requirements to the computer power necessary for these programs. Usually, requirements to the work station where the system client part is working are lower than the requirements to the server computer serving several clients and fulfilling the hardest part of work.

The following supply options of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT are possible:
Installation client server network option. The server part of the system is installed on a designated powerful computer. User PC's are used to launch the client parts of the system (program shells). The system may be used by a great number of users simultaneously, the number being restricted only by the server power and the network capacity.
Installation network file server option. The network file server option is a set of program files and data files located on the file server available through the network. The launching of the file server option includes the launching of the client shells on the work stations; the designated server part is not available. This implies opportunities of installation of the file server option on any servers regardless of the operating system, as well as opportunities to install and update the program shells and data from any Windows work station. This is also the source of limitations of the file server option as compared to the client server option, namely, impossibility to update the data without disconnection of the users working with the system and impossibility of exchange of folders and bookmarks among users. As to the rest, the file server option possess the same functional features as the client server option, however, because of its limitations, it is recommended to install it only when installation of the client server option is impossible, for example, when you do not have a Windows NT or higher server meeting the minimum requirements.
Installation local option. The server and client parts are united in a single unit and are installed together on the same user computer. Only one user can work with the system on the given computer. Installation of both parts is fulfilled automatically and does not require any separate actions in the course of system installation.
Working disk (DVD) The working option is a set of program and data files recorded on the DVD. The use of the working disk does not require installation of the shell (its installation includes inserting the disk in the drive). The update is a change of disks in the drive. A limitation of the working option is that it works slower than the installation one, since the speed of data retrieving from the DVD is lower than that from the hard disk.

Basic search (Basic Search Window)
The view of the Basic Search window is determined by the content of the Main Window. If at the moment of invoking of the Basic Search the Main Window contains only the Main Menu, list or document, the Basic Search window will include only the Basic Search panel. In other cases, in addition to the Basic Search panel, the window will include a screentip and the list of the history of requests.
Basic Search

Task panel (Task Panel Window)
The Task Panel is a new interface element having accumulated professional features of the system for working with any object (document, list, search). The Task Panel is invoked with the button of the main toolbar or the Task Panel command and is a tab of the navigation panel listing as hyperlinks the main commands that apply to the object opened in the Main Window.
Task Panel

My Documents (Dialogue box for saving in folders)
In the upper part of the window, select the folder to place the saved object. By default, it is saved in the route directory of My Documents folder. In the lower part of the window, you can change the name and remark to the saved object. If the saved object is an ordinary document, you can order the system to flag it.
Saving in Folders
Monitoring Changes

Online Legal Support (Query card to get legal support. Permits to enter the text of the question to send to the Online Legal Support Service.)
The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.
The subject of the request must by in compliance with The Rules of Work with the Online Legal Support Service, the volume of the text must not be greater than 6,000 characters.
To send the request to the Garant Company Online Legal Support Service, press Send Request or use the key combination Ctrl+Enter.
Online Legal Support
Sending the Request

Advice (Text of the advice)
The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.
The window is opened when you select the request in My Advice folder. The text of the advice depends on the location in folders and the request status:
Location
(folder name) Status Advice text
Out-going requests
Ready for sending
Not available
Requests in progress
Sent
Not available
Requests in progress
Notification received
Request text;
terms (time and cost) of service;
confirmation form;
Replies

Request text;
additional information (name of organisation, time when the reply is ready; complexity; account balance and information on the author of the advice) ;
reply of the advisor;
Unconfirmed

Not available
The text of the advice may not supplemented with a user comment, however, as in the case with the text of an ordinary GARANT System document, you can apply export operations to it.
Viewing Advice

Answer Mark (Intended for assessment of provided advice)
The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.
The mark may assume one of the five values (Not Sure, Excellent, Good, Satisfactory and Unsatisfactory) , as well as may be supplemented with a comment up to 300 characters long. To send the request to Garant Company Online Legal Support Service, press Assess or use the key combination Ctrl+Enter.
Before sending the request, the shell checks whether the advice service is available, and if not, acts the same way as if sending the request.
Assessing the Advice

Advice (List of GARANT System documents supplementing the advice)
The features described on the given page are available to only those GARANT System users that are connected to the online legal support service. More details on the service may be found in section What Is the Online Legal Support.
The list supplementing the advice is always left unchanged. That is if you change the list (for example, delete several documents from it) and then select the advice from the folder Replies again, the list will be displayed the way it was received from the Legal Advice Service. To save the changes (refining, filtering, addition, intersection with other lists etc.)
in the list, you should save it in folders and continue your work with the saved copy.
Lists

Shutdown Warning (Warning of the shutdown of the server of the network version of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT)
All users working with the system will be disconnected within 30-second timeout, after which the server will be turned off.
For information on the reasons of the shutdown of the server of Platform F1 EXPERT, apply to the system administrator or the person in charge of the work of GARANT System in your organisation. The server must be restarted to continue your work with the network version of Platform F1 EXPERT.
Picture 132
Warning of the shutdown of the server of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT and automatic user disconnection after the timeout.

Long Operation (Warning of the update of the databank of GARANT System Platform F1 EXPERT)
The message implies that the updating of the databank is in progress. You can renew your work with Platform F1 EXPERT when the updating is over. If you do not press the Exit button, the shell will automatically switch over to the updated database when the updating is over.
The system permits you to continue your work in the course of updating of the databank. If you want to be able to continue your work with the databank while its updating is in progress, apply to the system administrator or the person in charge of GARANT System updates in your organisation.

Forget Password? (Intended for sending the forgotten login/password to the e-mail address indicated at registration)

Printer
Name, selection list. List of available printing devices (printers).

Copies

Collate, check box. If checked, the printer will first print all pages of the first copy, then the second etc. If not checked, the printer will print several copies of the first page, then several copies of the second etc.

Select language, button. Part of the documents in the database are available in several languages. Such documents may be printed in any of these languages regardless of the current interface language of the program shell.

Contents

Text ()
GARANT System document is the main information unit of the database. Create New Filter (Displays the query card to be filled with new filter conditions.)
Filtering

Filters ()
The tab contains the list of filters.
The filters are the earlier saved requests that may be used to filter automatically all opened document lists.
The filtering implies an intersection of the opened list with the multitude of documents, the set being determined by the filters (one or several). In other words, the result of filtering produces the list of only those documents that would be present in it if generated through the search with the filter request (or several requests).
Requests that should be used as a filter are specified with command Use as filter. To make the filter request active, use command Enable filter. You can also enable or disable the filter by putting a checkmark against it. All active filters are disabled with command Clear all filters
Picture 157
List of filters. Two of them are active. The document list opened in the Main Window is automatically filtered with active filters. A floating warning appears over the list.

Embedded Object (Link to a file of free type attached to the document and saved in GARANT System database)
Attached files may include, for example:
audio or video files,
blank forms of documents in MS Word or MS Excel,
packed .zip files.
To open such file, appropriate application must be installed in the operating system. For example, if you want to listen the anthem of the Russian Federation, the system must have installed the player of audio files (Windows Media Player, Winamp or other), and to view the .xls file, you will need MS Excel.
Many attachments to the normative acts contain document forms - specimens of blank forms for filling and printing. For many important forms, Garant Company creates templates in MS Word or MS Excel for quality printing. As a result, the document forms are available not only in the initial text format, but also in a special format, making them fit for quality printing.
You can also save the attached file to disk. Use command Save to file... invoked with the shortcut menu of the attached object.

Refine List (Fulfils Search by Details among documents of the current list.)
Loads the query card of Search by Details while filling automatically the modifier Search List. The search with the specified details will cover only the current list rather than the whole database.
Sometimes, you need to refine the search results after a successful execution of the request. This is possible, for example, if the obtained list appears too big, and it makes sense to include additional search details to restrict the search area.
The list must not necessarily be built as a result of the previous search. You can search any active list regardless of the method of its obtaining. The active list may be obtained, for example, as a result of navigation through the classifier or as a list of Respondents.
It may happen that when the command was invoked, there were two lists on the screen in the simultaneous view regime (see window Simultaneous View (Respondents, Correspondents)). In this case, the given command applies to the list in the system Main Window.

Fit in Window (Scales the image so as to make it fit in the preview window.)

Redo (Command returning most recent change abandoned earlier in the list or document.)
Undo (command)

Undo (Abandons changes to the list or document.)
Let us list the changes covered by this command for the list and document.
For the list:
Sort
Paste
Delete
Add to list...
Intersect list...
Subtract list...
In the window with the changed list, there appears a floating warning List Changed. If the revocation command is invoked with the shortcut menu of this screentip, it revokes all actions fulfilled with the list. The list returns to the state it used to be at the moment of generation.
You can return the abandoned changes with the reverse command Redo.
For the document:
Show invalid document wording. See group of commands Document Wordings. If showing a wording not being in effect, there appears a floating warning Overdue Wording.
Show document in excerpts. The action is enabled with commands Open documents in excerpts or Show/Hide excerpts. When showing document in excerpts, there appears a floating Warning Document in Excerpts.
Adding Comments.
Adding Hyperlinks.
Turning Comments off.
You can rollback the changes using the shortcut menu of the floating screentips.
You can return the abandoned changes with the reverse command Redo.

Exit (Closes the current GARANT System window and/ or terminates the work with the system.)
Closes the current GARANT System window.
To close the window, you can also use standard operating system resources, for example, the key combination Alt-F4 or the cross in the upper right corner of the window. They produce the same action.
The command applies to the current window only without affecting other opened system windows.
When you close the last window, your session with GARANT System is terminated. The current system configuration is saved in the user profile.
Ending Work

Add to List... (Supplements the current list with documents of another list saved in folders.)
Command opens the folder window and suggests to choose an earlier saved list A whose documents will supplement the current list B. The result of amalgamation of A + B is shown on the screen. It will contain all documents available in at least one of the source lists.
Such amalgamation of the lists permits to obtain the sum of two lists, which may be convenient, in particular, when compiling thematic collections.
To return to the source list it used to be before the addition operation, use command Undo.
There is a fellow operation where the result of A + B is not shown on the screen but is saved in folders instead of list А. See page Add.
Picture 188
Illustration of logic operations with lists. The grey colour is used to show the resulting set of documents for operations of addition (A+B), intersection (A*B) and subtraction (A-B).
Logic Operations

Intersect List... (Intersects current list with documents of another list saved in folders.)
Command opens the folder window and suggests to choose an earlier saved list to intersect with the current list. The result of intersection will show the documents common for both source lists. In other words, the resulting list will include only those documents that were available in each of the source lists.
To return to the source list it used to be before the operation, use command Undo.
Picture 189
Illustration of logic operations with lists. The grey colour is used to show the resulting set of documents for operations of addition (A+B), intersection (A*B) and subtraction (A-B).
Logic Operations

Subtract List... (Subtracts from the current list documents of another list saved in folders.)
Command opens the folder window and suggests to choose an earlier saved list to exclude the documents from the current one. The result of intersection will contain documents unique for the current list. In other words, the resulting list will include only those documents of the first list that are not available in the second list.
To return to the source list it used to be before the operation, use command Undo.
Picture 190
Illustration of logic operations with lists. The grey colour is used to show the resulting set of documents for operations of addition (A+B), intersection (A*B) and subtraction (A-B).
Logic Operations

Add (Adds to the earlier saved list the documents of the saved list. The amalgamated list is recorded in folders over the existing one.)
Command adds to the earlier saved list A the documents of the current (saved) list B. The amalgamated list A + B is recorded in folders instead of list A.
To fulfil such an amalgamation while preserving the current document list, you should select one of the lists saved in folders earlier. The amalgamation button will become available, the name and comment of the selected list will be entered in the Properties Panel as the properties of the saved list. They may be left intact or changed.
When you press the button, the selected list will be replaced with the result of amalgamation.
Amalgamation is also possible when saving a single document (Insert bookmark). The saved document will be added to the documents of the existing list.
There a fellow operation Add to list... where the result A + B is not saved in folders but is shown on the screen.
Saving in Folders
Add to List...

Add (Adds to the earlier saved list the documents of the saved list. The amalgamated list is recorded in folders over the existing one.)
Command adds to the earlier saved list A the documents of the current (saved) list B. the amalgamated list A + B is recorded in folders instead of list A.
To fulfil such an amalgamation while preserving the current document list, you should select one of the lists saved in folders earlier. The amalgamation button becomes available, and the name and comment of the selected list will be entered in the Properties Panel as the properties of the saved list. They may be left intact or changed.
When you press the button, the selected list will be replaced with the result of amalgamation.
The amalgamation is also possible when saving a single documents (Insert bookmark). The saved document will be added to the documents of the existing list.
There is a fellow operation Add to list... where the result of A + B is not saved in folders but is shown on the screen.

Search by Details in Current List (Performs Search by Details among the current list documents.)
Loads the query card of Search by Details while setting up automatically the modifier Find in List. The search by specified details will apply to the current list rather than the whole of the database.
Sometimes, you need to refine the search results after fulfilling the request successfully. This may be the case when the obtained list is too big, and it makes sense to specify additional search details to restrict the search area.
The list must not necessarily be generated as a result of the previous search. The search may apply to any active list regardless of the method of its obtaining. The active list may, for example, be obtained after navigation through the classifier or as a list of Respondents.
It may happen that when the command was invoked, there were two lists on the screen in the simultaneous view regime (see window Simultaneous View (Respondents, Correspondents)). In this case, the given command applies to the list in the system Main Window.

New (Opens a new GARANT System Principle Window.)
The opened window is used to load the page indicated in the system settings. The set of tabs of the Navigation Panel shown by default is also specified in the settings.
The new window permits to work the same way as in the source window. All system Principle Windows are functioning independently of each other.
The settings and folders of different windows are common. In other words, the changes introduced while working in different windows are synchronised with each other. For example, the list saved in folders in one of the windows becomes visible in the folders of other windows.

The work with several system Principle Windows occurs independently like the work with several separate program copies.
The closing of one of the windows with the Exit command does not affect in any way the status of the remaining windows.

Enable Filter (Command making the mentioned filter active. A switching mark appears against the active filter. The current list is refreshed automatically.)
You can enable and disable the filter with the mark by clicking on it with the mouse.
A free number of filters may be active simultaneously. Each of the active filters sifts its part of the documents failing to meet the filter requirements. Unmarked, inactive filters are not involved in the filtering process.
Picture 208
List of filters. The active ones, i.e. affecting all displayed document lists, are two of them: Registered and Actual.
Quick Filter Enabling
Opportunities of quick enabling or disabling of each of the filters may be necessary in numerous situations. If you have only one filter, you can compare the filtered and non-filtered versions of the current document list by disabling it. If you have several filters on the tab, you can filter the current list with various combinations of filters depending on the solved task, its subject, context of work etc.
Actually, with a single click of the mouse enabling the filter, the current list is searched with a request specified in advance. Therefore, it is recommended to spend time and generate you own, personal set of filters for convenience of your daily work. Most probably, they will consist of conditions you are using most often when compiling search requests.
Filters (tab)
Filtering

Refresh Filters (Command permitting to forcibly filter the current document list anew.)
Automatic list filtering with a set of filters active at the present moment is fulfilled in the following cases only:
When loading the list. When the list is opened, the system applies all active filters to it.
When enabling/disabling the filter(s) with commands Enable Filter and Clear All Filters. Since the set of active filters is changed, the system filters the list anew.
When deleting the active filter from the tab Filters using command Delete.
In all other situations, repeated filtering is not fulfilled, and the list remains unchanged. In this case, you may need the forced filtering command.
Let us load, for example, in the system Main Window a filtered document list. If, in another window, you edit and save anew the search request serving as one of the active filters, the current document list will not change. However, you can filter it forcibly if necessary. A repeated filtering will take account of all changed conditions.
Filters (tab)
Filtering

Insert Bookmark... (Inserts bookmark in the beginning of the current paragraph. The current paragraph is the one indicated by the pointer.)
If you initiate this command, the system will display the folder window and suggest to enter the name of the saved bookmark. If you wish, the inserted bookmark may be supplied with an explanatory comment. By default, the system will suggest the name of the bookmark and comment describing in detail the name of the document and the position where the bookmark is inserted.
The bookmark will be saved in your personal folders. Later, when you go to it, the system will open the necessary document at the fragment with the inserted bookmark.
Picture 214
Inserting a bookmark in document text.
After you insert a bookmark, there appears the sign Bookmark (icon) against the beginning of the paragraph and an appropriate link in the document contents in section Bookmarks.
The bookmarks may be inserted not only in the document text, but also in the text of the reference to document.
Information on the document wording is also saved together with the bookmark where it is placed. If the document is shown in one of the previous wordings at the moment of inserting of the bookmark, the same, previous document wording will be loaded when you open this bookmark.
Bookmarks

Insert Bookmark in Document (Inserts bookmark in the beginning of the document.)
After initiation of the this command, the system will display the folder window and suggest to enter the name of the saved bookmark. If you wish, the inserted bookmark nay be supplied with an explanatory comment. By default, the system will suggest the name of the bookmark and comment describing in detail the name of the document and the position where the bookmark is inserted.
The bookmark will be saved in your personal folders. Later, when you open the bookmark, the system will open the necessary document at the fragment with inserted bookmark.
After you insert the bookmark, there appears the sign Bookmark (icon) against the first paragraph, and an appropriate link in the document contents in section Bookmarks.
Information on the document wording is saved together with the bookmark where it is placed. If the document is shown in one of the previous wordings at the moment of inserting of the bookmark, the same, previous document wording will be loaded when you open this bookmark.

Filtering Folder Elements by Type (Leaves visible only folder elements of specified type. Choose from the list the type of saved objects (bookmarks, lists ... ) that should be left on the screen.)
Leaves visible the elements of the Folders tree of specified type only. For example, you may wish to show only bookmarks or only requests. Elements of other types will become temporarily invisible. The folders left empty after filtering will also be hidden.
To fulfil such filtering, choose the type name from the drop-down list on the toolbar. Element types that may be saved in folders are listed on the page Folder Element.
Picture 216
Filtering folder content by type. In the illustration: all folder element types are hidden except for the filter requests.
Filtering by type is convenient when you need to find quickly the necessary element among numerous neighbouring elements of various types. Besides, the type of selected element is important in some operations. In such cases, the system will turn on the filtering automatically. For example, in logical operations with document lists, it makes sense to choose only lists from folders. Therefore, in the context of the logical operation, the system will turn on the filtering automatically to hide unnecessary bookmarks and requests.
Folder Element
